Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, fabulous terrace, good room”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoExPat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long Easter weekend in Venice with the bf. The hotel itself was beautiful and having breakfast on the terrace on the Grand Canal was priceless. The interior staircase is stunning. Great location right next to the dock for the #1 Vaporetto line so easy to get in and out with bags and without vast water taxi expense. Also very easy to hop on to St Marks. Expensive of course but what in Venice isn't and by Venice standards it was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandboyBermuda
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Hotel Palazzo Stern in Venice and it was again a great experience. We stayed here 3 years ago with our two kids and had a fantastic time. This time it was just my wife and I and the experience was the same. From the great welcome back when we arrived on our water taxi to suggestions for dinner and things to see....The Palazzo Stern is the place to stay. We had a room overlooking the Grand Canal and we enjoyed looking out the large windows and watching the boat traffic go past. It is always amazing to see how many boats go up and down the canal and the hotel is in a perfect location to view the activity and also close enough to walk or ferry to any location in Venice. Roberto is one of the owners and a delight to meet. He and his staff run a first class hotel and I would suggest to anyone going to Venice. We just love it there and will be back as both the hotel and the city are so special. You will not go wrong staying here....I promise you. Larry Lamb

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and room”
Reviews.Author: DDWelsh
Reviews.Content: Tremendous location, helpful staff and grand accomodation. The bathroom while luxurious was a little over done and would have been improved by a more conventional shower arrangement. While there during a very cold spell I imagine the canal side terrace bar to be very inviting at other times. Venice is rarely cheap but this seemed good value with some excellent restaurants nearby. Having previously tried the Gritti and the Barbarigo I would pick the Stern next time round.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: helga c
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently with our toddler son. I asked in advance to be given a room with a baby cot. This was supplied, but it was the worst possible room for a couple with a child. The room was split on two levels with a steep staircase in the middle of the room. This presented a safety hazard and extremely dangerous for a young child (no stairgates, obviously). We were really exhausted after a long journey to Venice with a young child, and this was a huge disappointment. I dont understand how this wasn't thought out. I asked for a different room, and the one that we were given was very small to be able to fit a baby cot in (they had to remove some furniture to fit it in). We were told that as the hotel was fully booked, this was all they could offer for the night. I was told though that there was a chance that we could move to a bigger room but this could not be established until the following day. Very frustrating as obviously did not know if i could unpack or not. Really difficult again, with a young child and all the things I needed from the bags. The following day, we asked about moving to a different room, as we had not heard, and we were told that we were too late, as all the rooms had gone as we had not asked that morning, despite being told the day before that we would be informed about whether we would get a new room. The staff admitted that a note had been left out to them about it. Obviously a huge misunderstanding. After a long discussion with them about this (which did feel like we were pleading), we were eventually offered a new room, which was lovely. I just wished we had received this in the first place. I just donâ€™t want any other couples with infant children to be offered that room as otherwise i would be really worried about it â€“ I think it's room number 102 from memory. It's on the ground floor reception level. I emailed the hotel 12 days ago asking them to not offer this room to people with a young child, and they havent bothered to respond. I dont want you to be disappointed. If you wait until you arrive at the hotel to find out that you have this room, there's a huge chance that you wont be able to move rooms due to the hotel being heavily booked. For couples without families i also wouldnt recommend it as it is very dark and has a tiny window, with a terrible view. I would strongly advise you to find out what your room number is before you go. The rooms do vary alot. The best rooms are on the second and third levels. My husband and I travel alot and I have never before written a review on tripadvisor, but this experience has made me feel compelled to write one. You will enjoy your stay at the hotel - if you're lucky enough to have the right room. ps the two philopino waiting staff that we encountered were amazing - they worked really hard, were always courteous and just generally went out of their way. Not sure about some of the other staff we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast right on the canal”
Reviews.Author: RafeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Nothing beats having breakfast or an early evening cocktail right on the canal. The location is perfect and right beside Ca Rezzonico a grand palazzo that is a must see. You can walk everywhere and it's close to the Academia. The rooms are clean and comfortable offering great views of the Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Magical first visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Soo S
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern was just a great choice of hotel on many levels. Location (on the grand canal, beautiful terrace right on the canal - ideal for breakfast and morning coffee. The staff were just so attentive and kind - always keen to help with any queries. Our room and all the public rooms were spotlessly clean. The whole experience at the Palazzo Stern was brilliant. The staff booked for us to see an opera one evening at a private house - it was superb. We jumped on and off the water bus from outside the hotel - it was all so convenient. A marvellous break in a spectacular hotel. With many thanks to all the hotel staff who made our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “One of Venice's Finest Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Outnabout2005
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Palazzo Stern in Venice as a result of a recommendation from friends who had stayed there before. We were not disappointed. It was our 25th anniversary and booked a junior suite for three nights to celebrate. We were a little late in booking and could probably have done better on the rate had we booked earlier. That said, the hotel did not disappoint. The accommodation was bed and breakfast with a bar service throughout the day and evening. Breakfast can be taken in-room at no extra charge but the selection is obviously better in the intimate dining room or terrace if the weather is nice. Dinner is not served in the hotel but if it were to be needed for any reason then the hotel make it clear that anything is possible. For our 25th anniversary, a complimentary bottle of chilled Prosecco was waiting in the room. The hotel is an old Doge palace and retains an historic feel. The rooms are typically Venetian in furnishing and the bathrooms well equipped (ours had a jacuzzi bath). I know you don't go to Venice to watch TV, but for the sake of completeness it should be noted that English speaking news channels are limited to CNN only. WIFI Internet is available at a cost in room, and a PC with web access is on the first floor library area. The hotel's location on the Grand Canal in the Dorsoduro district is perfect for many reasons. First and foremost it is on the Grand Canal between Rialto and San Marco. It is one of few such hotels that has a front terrace at water level on which to sit and enjoy the weather and Venetian life. Next to the hotel is the Ca' Rezzonico waterbus stop with services every 10 minutes north and south on the Number 1 route. There is also a 50cent Traghetto Gondole ferry crossing here too, across the canal, to the San Marco side, where there is a waterbus stop for the Number 2 route. The Rialto bridge is four stops north and San Marco is 4 stops south. The Ponte Academia is in sight of the terrace and the Gallerie dell'Accademia is just behind the bridge. The area to the west of the hotel is much quieter (campo san barnaba) than many other areas of Venice, well served by eateries and cafes and provides a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of other parts of Venice. The hotel booked tickets for us to a concert of the Interpreti Veneziani in the Chiesa di San Vidal. This church was a beautiful setting for a recital of Vivaldi's Four Seasons by this talented ensemble. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Overall a great hotel and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Honeymoon Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsG2012
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have recently returned from our honeymoon in Venice and we had the most amazing time at the beautiful Palazzo Stern! We have visited Venice a number of times but have never stayed on the Grand Canal and wanted to do so for our special trip. After researching a number of hotels we chose a Junior Suite at Palazzo Stern which has a view of the Grand Canal. When we arrived we were absolutely delighted with our room which not only had a view of the Grand Canal but also a balcony and there was a bottle of chilled Prosecco waiting for us! The room was not the only amazing aspect of this hotel, it was like staying in a museum with chandeliers everywhere, tapestries on the wall and mosaics on the floors. The breakfast was excellent with lots of choice of hot and cold foods and the staff were always willing to help. Although this hotel is on the opposite side of the Grand Canal to a lot of the major sights such as St Marks Square and the Doge's Palace the location was not a problem for us. There is a vaporetto stop on the number 1 line just outside the hotel and it is only short walk to the Accademia bridge so you can be on the other side very quickly. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, we had an amazing time and would certainly suggest paying the extra for a Junior Suite as there is nothing quite like watching the traffic on the Grand Canal from your very own balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: evafoi
Reviews.Content: We had a junior suite in the second floor with view on the Canal Grande and stayed 3 days. The service was excellent, the breakfast was overwhelming, the room was excellent and obviously our view was breathtaking.... It is perfectly situated in the heart of Venice, in front of the hotel is the bus taxi stop, with which you reach the piazza san marco in 5 minutes. All in all it was an unforgettable stay. We will come back, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Palazzo!”
Reviews.Author: steeletraveller
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time staying the the Hotel Palazzo Stern. On arrival, our bags were carried into the hotel for us, and as 2 other couples had arrived at the same time, we were given a complimentary drink at the bar while we waited to check-in (didn't take long at all, but made a very good first impression). Staff were all very helpful and polite, and didn't fail to say hello. The room was beautiful - nicely furnished and kept very clean. As we were on our honeymoon, a bottle of prosecco had been put in our room - a lovely touch! The hotel location was great, in a quieter residential area but less than a 5minute walk from the Accademia bridge and with a vaporetto stop just outside - we would definately recommend Palazzo Stern for those looking to come to Venice but avoid the hassle of staying right in the touristy spots.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Stern”
Reviews.Author: 12vesna
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern is a great location on the Grand Canal, vaporetto stop near of the hotel. Many good restarans and bars around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: helidonaki
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing 5 night stay in Venice! Palazzo Stern is gorgeous(I have a weakness for Fortuny lamps and mosaics), very convenient to vaporetto ( Ca Rezzonico stop in front of hotel). The area around the hotel is full of great restaurants and stores without the crazy crowds of St. Mark's. There is no restaurant or room service, but the abundance of eating options in the area made it not matter. Beautiful breakfast room and terrace. Stay on the second floor facing the Grand Canal and enjoy the views!

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed in Italy”
Reviews.Author: desert_lover222
Reviews.Content: We just completed a three-night stay and were very pleased. The hotel has a great location, right on the Grand Canal and right at a vaporetto stop. Be sure to get a room facing the canal - it's a little noisy with the window open but definitely worth it for the view. We arrived by water taxi after dropping off our rental car, and Fauzi came right out to the landing to help with our bags, then brought us juice as we checked in. Sandro greeted us warmly at the desk and had us sit in a leisurely fashion as he registered us and provided information about the hotel and the neighborhood. The interior of the hotel and the room were beautiful, with much attention to detail. Breakfast was excellent, with cappuccino and eggs available. There was turndown service at night. Room amenities were excellent. Overall we had a fabulous stay and would return at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as the reviews said...”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveller1012
Reviews.Content: We (family of 5) stayed in March, in a junior suite, and booked one of the rooms that overlooks the Grand Canal. The hotel met every expectation. Room was great, beds and pillows fine, view was excellent, the location is perfect (right next to the Vaparetto stop; don't get ripped off by a water taxi like I did; just catch the Vaparetto Route#1 to Ca' Rezzonico stop, literally 20m from the hotel entrance) and the breakfast each morning was really good. In addition to that, the hotel is about 100m from some great local restaurants, and only about a 30min walk from St Marks Square. The conceirge gave us a good map and easy instructions how to do the walk, and we were good to go. Only criticism is that when we were there the air conditoining wasn't working - not a problem in March, but would be a major issue in the warmer months - check it's fixed if you're going in summer!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience, Stunning location”
Reviews.Author: goblue00
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel in February. It is truly a uniquely Venetian experience; everything about the hotel is fabulous. Everything about the hotel surpassed our expectations, from the service to the room itself. It is a true gem of a hotel in a city where there are many bad options. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Every Expectation”
Reviews.Author: LCassell
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hotel Palazzo Stern after reading glowing reviews, establishing hope that the hotel would live up to the compliments and fear that it couldn't possibly do so. My husband and I booked our holiday well in advance, with the stretch of long winter months to anticipate a long-awaited return to Venice in March. I sent an email to the hotel, telling them that we would be celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary. A very courteous and prompt reply assured us we would have a lovely room and that everything would be done to assure our comfort and pleasure. And so it was! Our standard double room overlooked a small garden, suiting us perfectly well. A bottle of wine and very kind welcome were sent to our room the night of our arrival, wishing us a lovely anniversary. We had thought that the weather would be misty and chilly but instead every day was sunny and mild, allowing us to take breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. Every person we encountered at the hotel was delightful, caring for us and assisting us in every way. This is old school accommodation, the sort often decried as having vanished in these times. We heartily endorse all of the recommendations made by others and encourage anyone who wants a memorable visit to one of the world's most beautiful cities to select the Hotel Palazzo Stern. Thank you to all....may we return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime as always”
Reviews.Author: cohenfamily
Reviews.Content: Returned to The Palazzo Stern again with my daughter. Always a treat. Great location. Right on a Vaparetto stop. Inspiring hotel. Exquisite details all through the hotel. Truly the essence of Venice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Basalt2003
Reviews.Content: Our small party was made up of four couples. We spent five days in Venice and had the most delightful stay which was perfectly complemented by the relaxed and comfortable surroundings this hotel offered. I do not recall one bad experience during our stay and can only reiterate others comments as to the service and courtesy of ALL the staff. The surroundings are spotlessly clean and beautiful. The area/location is perfect and adjacent to a vaporetto stop. Breakfasts were relaxed and well managed with the staffs trademark courtesy. My only suggestion might be that the "Wi fi" information be included in the room literature although I guess its not difficult to ask:) We had wonderfull weather clear blue skys and sunshine and the magic of Venice was made just that that bit more special. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our very first trip to Venice, what a perfect hotel! The hotel itself is stunning and right on the Grand Canal. My husband and I took a water taxi from the airport and when we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by 2 staff members who gave us a very warm welcome. While checking in we were brought a refreshing glass of juice and were given a map of the city and shown a number of places we should consider going to see. The room we stayed in was a Junior Suite and when we walked in it took my breath away! We stayed in room 404 which is overlooking the Grand Canal. If there was a way I could have smuggled the entire bathroom out in our luggage I would have. Gorgeous!! The hotel doesn't have a restaurant for afternoon or evening meals but that's ok because there are so many places right around the hotel worth trying out. They do serve a lovely breakfast and while we were there the weather was perfect so we ate our breakfast each morning on the terrace, again overlooking the Grand Canal. There is a Vaporetto stop literally right beside the hotel which couldn't be more perfect and the Ca' Rezzonico Museum is just steps away, one museum not to be missed! On our last night there we rented the rooftop jacuzzi and ordered a bottle of Prosecco. There is no better way to end your stay at this magical hotel than to do this. We have already decided we will return to Venice again next year, there is still so much we want to see and do and the Hotel Palazzo Stern is the only place we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location! Definite recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after checking up on TripAdvisor for our first visit to Venice. From the airport, we decided to get a water taxi (surely the only way to arrive in Venice!) which took us directly to the hotel, where we were greeted by the concierge and porter straight off our boat. Checkin was nice and simple, and we were given a map of Venice with a short introduction of some places woth visiting. Wow, what a beautiful hotel. The decor is impressive, especially the alcove on the 2nd floor! Our room was a junior suite overlooking the Grand Canal, superb. So lovely to watch canal life go by out the window first thing in the morning or last thing at night. The small hallway to our room was also decorated with little lights in the curved ceiling so it resembled a starry night! The room was well decorated and comfortable, no complaints! For our last night, we booked the rooftop jacuzzi for an hour, with a bottle of Prosecco. Really relaxing and worth it if you get a chance! Breakfast was nice, with a good selection, and you can eat on the terrace which overlooks the Grand Canal, great way to start the day. The location is superb, close to Rialto bridge, and San Marco. It is right next to the Ca'Rezzonico museum (a must-see!) and the Ca'Rezzonico vaporetto stop. This hotel is thoroughly recommended. Thank you so much to all the staff for making our first trip to Venice so wonderful, we will definitely stay here again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Timeless and Romantic Shakespearian”
Reviews.Author: CGenthnerJr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. We had a split level loft room that had old world charm. The staff was extremely attentive. (Grazie Alberto) Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the grand canal was both delicious and beautiful. We will stay here upon our return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dwasher
Reviews.Content: On arrival you are greeted with a glass of Orange juice, the reception staff provided us with a map and pointed out all the best things to see, they noticed that during our stay I would be cebrating my birthday which was nice, & they then showed us to our room which we got an upgrade to a Studio which was charming with a view of the Grand Canal! On my Birthday they left a bottle of Prosecco in the room with a card wishing me a happy birthday which was lovely. There is a good selection of fresh food at breakfast. There is a square right near the hotel where Indiana Jones last Cruscade was filmed (interesting fast) there is lots of restaurants, cafes & bars near by, however this hotel is out of the tourist area which we liked. It took about 20 minutes to walk to San Marco square ideal hotel in great location. Would highly reccomend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and beautiful hotel! Read for Travel Tip!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon S
Reviews.Content: I spent a while looking at various reviews on hotels to find the perfect one to take my wife away for her 40th birthday - In the end I decided on the Palazzo Stern and was not dissappointed. Even in the basic double room the furnishings were beautiful and you could not ask more from the friendly hotel staff. In summary I give this 5 stars for - Perfect location (Vaperetto stop just outside, on the grand canal, 5 minutes walk to loads of good bars, restaurants and shops) - Lovely hotel (clean, beautifully restored palace, quiet nights sleep!) - Good Value for money (not mega cheap, but not expensive given the quality of the room) I would highly recommend this for a romantic getaway to venice. Top tip - if coming from Marco Polo Airport get the boat (Alilaguna) to the Rialto (Orange Line), jump off and onto the local Vaperetto (and travel a couple of stops to the Ca Rezzonico and you're there! You can get tickets at the airport for the Alilaguna (25euros return) and buy individual tickets on the local Vaparetto if you haven't bought a 48 hour or 72 hour pass (recommended) - You can buy 24/48/72 hour tickets at the Rialto Stop during daytime.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect in that wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sophie V
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect! It is in a quiet street in the center of Venezia and you can easily go everywhere walking from the hotel. A vaporetto station is otherwise at 10 meters from the hotel. The staff is kind, attentionate and helpful. The room was great, big, clean and comfortable. The breakfast is delicious and varied and if the weather is great you can take it on the terrace in front of the Great Canal. When we'll come back, we certainly will book the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic good value hotel on grand canal”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas M
Reviews.Content: There are few better locations in venice for a hotel! The palazzo stern is ideal for a romantic stay in venice. The staff is very friendly, helpful and with attention to details. They offered a little surprise as birthday present! The breakfast is delicious with a great and fine choice. There is a vaporetto station just outside the hotel, which is very convenient. Only disappointment is the roof top jacuzzi that is charged 70euros per hour if you want to use it. Overall a very recommendable address in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “plan already the next trip to Pal. Stern, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Eberhard B
Reviews.Content: Hotel in best location, right on the banks of Canale Grande and with great view, very stylish interior decoration, perfect, efficient and very friendly service starting from welcome until farewell. Our room (junior suite) was big, well furnitured, very clean. In short: everything as we had expected it, maybe even better!!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: John295
Reviews.Content: Excellent position. Very professional set up with fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaryALorenzo
Reviews.Content: I located and booked my stay at the hotel thru a web site called luxurygroup.com. Upon arriving arriving at the hotel I was greeted by a friendly staff. The room was clean and comfortable and the terrace is located right on the Grand Canal with a beautiful view. Public transportation is located just steps away from the hotel. A pleasant experience from beginning to end. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope myself to revisiit in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Kerstin G
Reviews.Content: Very nice and friendly, perfect location, a few steps from the vaporettostop CA REZZINOCO. We booked the jacuzzi and had a nice view over the city while bathing, Prosecco was included in the price. Very good breakfast. We would like to stay here in the spring to enjoy the terass by the canal. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Luc B
Reviews.Content: For four days with your girlfriend, it's perfect. The style is very typical and you feel almost home. The jacuzzi on the top floor is amazing! Nevertheless the service is not the same than in a "Palace" (no restaurant, no room service, the bar closes at 11pm...).

Reviews.Title: “New favourite”
Reviews.Author: MrsBuchanan
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed at one of the large grand hotels and more recently at one of the new 'designed'palazzos. Whilst we enjoyed both these hotels our stay at the Palazzo Stern beats them both. The location is perfect for us as the Dosoduro is our favorite district - away from the crowds but an easy walk to the rest of Venice. The Accademia very close, St Mark's only 15 minutes away with a good selection of bars and restaurants nearby for the essential The palazzo is very beautiful and strikes the right balance between modern and traditional. We stayed in a junior suite with a Grand Canal view from 3 large windows. It took effort to drag ourselves out of the arm chairs in front of the window. Services warm and efficient. We were given very good restaurant recommendations. Breakfast is excellent. My new favorite and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible!”
Reviews.Author: TheRookieTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo Stern from 22/1/12 to 25/1/12 and we were extremely pleased with our choice. We had the Junior Suite on the third floor with a small balcony. Our room was very quiet, comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was exquisite and modern, stunningly decorated with beautiful mosaics. The curtains and the drapes looked little old but it wasn't really a huge concern for us. Our room and bathroom were always very clean. What I loved most about our room is the the huge windows and the small balcony that opens up to the stunning view of the Grand Canal. We were able to enjoy the view any time in the day while enjoying a glass of champage (complimentary upon our arrival) or coffee (complimentary for the entire the duration of our stay). The experience was almost magical! Some people complained about the noises from the vaporetto stop early in the morning but I must say it didn't even bother us one bit. The hotel looks absolutely stunning from outside and is definitely one of the most beautiful palazzos along the canal. The interior of the hotel is just as equally gorgeous. The deco is elegant and the extensive use of Murano glasses, vases, interesting mosaics everywhere adds to the ambience and Venetian charm. The breakfast room is really beautiful as well. Being our first visit to Venice, we found the location of the hotel cannot be more perfect and it is very easy to get to from the Santa Lucia train station on vaporetto. The neighbourhood is quiet yet charming and lovely to walk around day and night. There are many great restaurants along Calle Lunga San Barnaba which is only down the street from the hotel. Ca Rezonico vaporetto stop being right next door makes getting around on vaporetto extremely convenient. We were particularly thankful to the front desk who recommended that we buy a 2 days vaporetto pass as we did end up taking the vaporetto almost to all of the main attractions along the Grand Canal as well as to out to the Lagoon on the other side of Venice which were in fact some of the most enjoyable experiences while in Venice. The staffs at Palazzo Stern, from the front desk to the bell porter to the breakfast room were always gracious, polite, and couldn't be more helpful. We requested hot water and espresso every evening and it was delivered to our room within 5 minutes and all were complimentary. The hotel also helped us with our dinner reservations at restaurants and responds to my emails were also very prompt. Breakfast was fantastic with lots of healthy choices such as whole meal bread, fresh fruit, yogurt and juices. You could even request them to cook your eggs. Wifi connection was very fast as well. Overall, our stay at Palazzo Stern was incredible. We wouldn't stay anywhere else when we return to Venice next time.

Reviews.Title: “The best ..”
Reviews.Author: Gillian H
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Venice at the beginning of January for many years now, and have stayed in many different hotels; loved some of them. But since we discovered the Stern - that's it. We stay nowhere else - incredibly good deals at that time of year. The building is stunning, it has been beautifully and lovingly restored ( the building itself is not old, it was only erected in its current form at the the beginning of the last century, but Mrs Stern did in in the traditional Venetian style) The staff are beyond friendly and helpful. ( Last year when we were staying with friends who had rented a flat round the corner we were left with a whole day in Venice and nowhere to leave the luggage - we ran round and asked if we could leave it in the hotel and they said 'Of course'. SO kind of them, and we were VERY grateful) The rooms are gorgeous ( even the small ones) And what no-one talks about is that as far as I'm aware it's the only hotel (apart from the Gritti which is prohibitively expensive and very snooty) which has a terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. If you stay during the warmer months that's where you eat breakfast. And even in winter, with a coat on it's a delight to sit there with a cup of coffee or something stronger and watch the world float by. All in all, one of our favourite palaces to stay anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer...”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Palazzo Stern hotel was very easy to find. We used the public transport and found it very easy and convenient to locate the hotel because it had a public transport boat stop directly in front. Before arriving at the hotel we consulted their website for directions. I feel that the website could be updated a little bit to show just how easy and convenient the hotel is to locate. For example, adding a map of the Alilaguna and vaporetto lines would be helpful. We arrived early and were warmly greeted at the front door with fresh orange juice and coffee. Our room was beautiful, it had a small balcony that overlooked the canal. Our breakfast was served in our room by the very friendly bellboy (who made an excellent cappuccino and americano). As is typical throughout Italy, don't expect a huge American style breakfast! However, do expect fresh rolls and delicious coffee. The hotel also booked us a Murano glass factory tour. This tour was a lot of fun because a small boat picks you up at the hotel and brings you to the glass factory for free. It is important to note that the glass company will not drop you back off at your hotel for free; however, there is public transportation off of the island and it is very inexpensive and easy to use. The hotel is also very close to Piazza San Marco and is just about a block away from the gelato chain Grom. My only regret is that we did not stay in Venice longer. I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: we travelled end of January 2012. The hotel promises great location and Venician charm. We have booked directly through the hotel website. Pro: Great location, great views, lovely bathroom, quite, Junior suite great, email exchange responsive, booked theatre tickets for us. Cons: fake old, it seems renovation changed its course from trued to the roots of an old palace to- lets finish quickly, steely - chrome bar, fake pillars, watermarks in the ceiling, heating not adjustable, coffee machine not working, breakfast sad, loveless, subpar and max 3* quality Summary: OK-ish, value for money based on Junior Suite: 3/5

Reviews.Title: “sublime”
Reviews.Author: julia f
Reviews.Content: I travel 14-16 weeks a year. Palazzo Stern is one of my favorite places to stay. The service, the beauty, and the serenity are sublime. The location is central; everything is accessible; and yet, you are out of the fray.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lemonteil
Reviews.Content: It has an old palace, very well renovated. A wonderful, very convenient location overlooking the Grand Canal,right next to the Ca' Rezonica water bus stop, close to the Academia and 10mn walk from ST Marco Plazza. The area is quiet with a lot of small, inexpensive restaurants. The terrace overlooking the Grand Canal is wonderful. Very kind and helpful front desk. A very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: FruitTrader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find, less pretentious than some of the other hotels on the Grand Canal, but no less beautiful and comfortable. The breakfast on the terrace overlooking the canal is a highlight of the stay. Friendly, attentive and comfort all make this a real pleasure, and by Venice standards at bargain prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: william n
Reviews.Content: It has a brilliant location overlooking the Grand Canal,right next to a water bus stop.Very helpful front desk.Prompt room service.And,for Venice, a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay at the Palazzo Stern”
Reviews.Author: krysg
Reviews.Content: I spent last week here and have nothing but praise for the establishment. The building itself and the setting are stunning. I found all of the staff - night and day - very helpful. The rooms were absolutely spotless, and much more comfortable and roomy than is often the case in Venice. It felt like staying in someone's home. My only slight quibble is that service at breakfast could have been quicker, although Junior was fantastic. The prices in January are very reasonable. In short, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Ben L
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to the Palazzo Stern for 3 nights from 2nd Jan 2012. We had booked from booking.com and had got an incredible deal - as it turns out, infinitely better than we had ever expected. Their website tells you very clearly how to find them using the water bus system - we are extensive world travellers (my partner is Scottish and I am a New Zealander) and this was perhaps the easiest hotel to find with their instructions, EVER. Add to that the nightmare that Venice can be with all of its back alleyways (we had been to the city before), and you have an immediate peace of mind. From the outside, especially at night, the hotel is stunning. Upon entering, the gentleman at the front desk stopped us, sat us down on two chairs, and took our bags from us. We gave our name the reservation was under and he immediately knew exactly who we were, our room, etc. A valet appeared as if from nowhere, gave us a glass of juice each, took our suitcases, and disappeared once more. Our friend at the front desk produced a map, our paperwork, receipts, and discussed our interests and how we may enjoy Venice to the fullest extent based on what we liked. We were then shown to our room, which was STUNNING. we got a doube suite (room 305)- a double window opening onto a tiny balcony overlooking the grand canal, ensuite with bath/jacuzzi/shower, bidet, 20m square overall. on our pillows was a weather prediction for the following day, and the porter then gave us instructions on how to work everything (TV, Safe, Phone, etc). The Espresso machine in the closet wasn't working, but was pointed out to us first thing and we were told whenever we wanted an espresso to call reception and they would be straight up. A very small downside was the TV, it took about 90-120 seconds of warming up before turning on - never worked out how to remedy that, but when you're in Venice, why are you watching TV anyway? The room came installed with a integrate radio system next to the bed and the toilet as well, which is a nice touch. We had brought a bottle of wine with us which turned out to be a cork - so after a quick phonecall to reception a porter came up and even opened it for us! The breakfasts were exceptional - bacon and scrambled eggs for the English, cold meats for the Europeans, fresh fruit, yoghurt and museli for the vegans, and pastries for the French. Add into this coffees made to order and its a brilliant way to start the day. Whilst we were travelling in Venice we noticed a "Venice tourist tax" advertised in the water bus pontoons - but they didn't say what this consisted of. When we were checking out, we found out. We had paid by C/Card before we left on our trip, but on the last day, there was an extra 8 Euro charge per night which was the tax - I don't know if the amount is standard but its just something to be aware of! Overall - we had an amazing time. The staff were friendly, SO helpful, the furnishings are exquisite (have a look upstairs - we had a sneaky look and its the most incredible chapel-type area!). We simply can't fault it. It helps that we got an amazing deal, and it was winter, but we take our hat off to you. Thanks folks, it was amazing. PS - a special mention to the housekeepers for being fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: tomlwright
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel was quite quiet when we went in November and therefore we were upgraded to a Canal view room which was much appreciated. The view was of course great, the room a decent size, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom particularly nice and large and everything tastefully decorated. Breakfast was also a solid 4 out 5, the interior of the hotel is also very nice, I can't complain about the staff and I enjoyed the location which was away from the crowds but close enough to walk to most places and convieniently close to a Valporetto stop - although this did make it noisy at times. In summary everything was good, but just perhaps missing that special something to give it the 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Extremly friendly stuff, great hotel, great location,an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Corinna W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautifull, the stuff so friendly and helpfull, that they made our stay very special! We enjoyed a really good breakfast with the view to the grand canal. The terrace facing the grand canal is even in winter wonderful. The hotel is all in the typical venice style. The waterbusstop is right in front of the hotel, for us everything was perfect!!! We thank the stuff so much for arranging the new years eve dinner and beiing passionate about what they are doing!

Reviews.Title: “Discovering Venice with family”
Reviews.Author: NFD1612
Reviews.Content: Super location especially with the vaporetto station just in front. Plus once you understand how it works in Venice you realise that the hotel is very well located and close to St Mark square and the Rialto Market place too. We really enjoyed walking from/to hotel especially that weather was quite ok.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: sestiere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palazzo Stern at the end of 2011 in two occasions. When I arrived the first time I found a bottle of prosecco in a cooler in my room with a note from management thanking me for choosing their hotel again (I had stayed at the hotel in December 2010). What a nice touch! The hotel staff is very attentive without being intrusive. The room was spacious, wonderfully appointed and kept spotless twice a day. Breakfast was excellent, as expected. Last year I made a comment about the bacon not being prepared according to the American taste (it wasn't crispy). I do not eat bacon but most American are fussy about it. I guess it's hard for non-American to understand that perfect point for bacon doneness. This year the bacon was perfect. It's a small detail, but it's the sum of the details, and their willingness to improve, that counts in the end. When I came back some ten days later, I arrived rather early and thought that I would have to wait for my room (I have requested the same room, if possible). Not only I got the same room, but it was ready by 10 am!! They apologized for not having the prosecco ready in my room. I said that I wasn't feeling too well, so I wasn't going to drink much alcohol, so the prosecco wasn't really necessary. When I came back later that day I found a huge platter of fruit wrapped in cellophane and a bottle of mineral water in the cooler and another note from management. Wow! In addition to this 5-star service, the hotel is an architectural jewel and it is located a few meters from the vaporetto stop Ca' Rezzonico, and within walking distance to all the important attractions in Venice: San Marco, Accademia, Campo Santa Margarita. There is free wi fi in the rooms and there is also a computer for guest access on the second floor. I have stayed in several hotels in Venice (this was my 10th trip). Many of them were excellent, but I have not found any hotel in Venice (or anywhere else for that matter) with a service as wonderful as in Palazzo Stern. A place to come back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, can't think of improvements”
Reviews.Author: gbmateo
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to find a perfect hotel, I think my wife and I found it for our recent 4 night say at the Palazzo Stern. --Location: I loved it. Some people might look at the map and say "not near St. Mark square, no good", I say no way. I loved the location about a 15-20min. walk from the square. We were in a great area with less traffic but still had restaurants, shops, cool scenery nearby. Half the fun of Venice is just walking and looking and my wife I loved walking to the square for the 15min. when we wanted. During the summer when Venice is crazy, I would imagine the location is a HUGE plus. In addition, there was a full service grocery store about 5min. way, this is always key for me as a way to save money. The hotel was also easy to get too by water taxi, no need to haul bags through side streets --Room/hotel: Slightly on the small side, but for my wife and I the standard room was perfect. It had great decor, very comfortable bed, awesome bathroom with six head shower. My wife loved the soap, shampoo hear too --Breakfast: Always important and it was great. High quality food, lots of choice, this was an hour of eating each day :) --Service: Awesome, everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The front desk guys were always helpful. The coffe machine didn't work so they offered free capuccinnos on demand. Whenever we asked, they had someone down there in 3min. To the owner/manager of the hotel, your employees are great. I don't know if I will ever make it back to Venice, but if I do, I am back at the hotel due in large part to them. Past reviews have mentioned a broken coffee pot, it was still broken but WHO CARES. They gave free coffee/espress on demand, way better. This is a great hotel, they could raise the price and still a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect, would absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: tansyliverwort
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing a 6 night stay at Palazzo Stern and highly recommend it. This is our 4th trip to Venice and on our other trips we've stayed at 5 star hotels (the Danieli and the Metropole) and, other than a bit of a glitch with the hot water (we had to wait 20 minutes between showers), it couldn't have been more perfect. Both internet and breakfast were included in the price of the room, something that we, of course, paid extra for at the other hotels. We booked a junior suite which happened to be a corner room overlooking the Grand Canal - again, less expensive that smaller rooms at the other hotels. It was beautifully furnished with plenty of closet and drawer space. Alberto, the concierge, was very helpful and always seemed pleased to see us. The hotel was simply charming, and on our next trip to Venice, we will absolutely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Palazzo Hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: kmalibu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Hotel Palazzo Stern in Venice. The first few nights we stayed in a wonderful suite and the last three nights a standard room. The suite was fantastic, however the standard room was a bit small. The service and staff are fantastic as well as the buffet breakfast. The hotel is situated not too far from San Marco, but is far enough away to be very quiet. It is also very close to local "restaurants" that are very reasonable. One of our favorites is Da Ignazio located not too far in San Polo. We discovered two new "fabs"-Osteria-Enoteca Ai Artisti for great pasta and wine; Al Profeta for the best pizza ever (33 different kinds. Both are very close to the Stern. I am a travel writer/producer and my husband is the former President of the Los Angeles Convention Center. We are very particular where we stay and found the Stern to be a great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Venise”
Reviews.Author: matthieu_shanghai
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 3 nights at Palazzo Stern and had a great stay. In brief: Antique architecture with perfect location on the Grand Canal, very convenient location, efficient and very warm service, well decorated room and excellent breakfast. They could only add more stuff in the bathroom (no dental kit available in the hotel) but this is a minor thing. Overall a great stay. Would definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zactyl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December 2011. The hotel is located on the Grand Canal just steps from the Ca'Rezzonico vaparetto stop. Our room was beautiful, as well as the bathroom, which had a shower with jets coming out of the walls. The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. Breakfast was good and consisted of eggs, bacon, cereals, pastries, meats, cheeses, yogurt, juice, coffee and tea. The hotel is in a good location and it is easy to hop on the vaparetto and see the sights of Venice. This is a top-notch hotel and we would definately stay there again as well as recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palazzo Stern - combining the experience of a luxury hotel and an art museum”
Reviews.Author: PabloAyala
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Palazzo Stern (photo 33) is combining the experience of a luxury hotel and an art museum at one of the world's most enticing venues â€“ Venice's Canal Grande. My mother (photo 37c) and me (photo 37d) stayed at the Stern 3 days at the end of November 2011, whilst waiting for the depart of our cruise to the Eastern Mediterranean. My mother sits on a wheel-chair and Signori Roberto, Alberto and the other extremely helpful hotel staff arranged for her speedy transfer by boat directly from the Marco Polo airport to the hotel pier by Sanitrans, a local company specialised in transportation of sick and disabled. In the otherwise for handicapped so inconvenient Venice, the Stern offers a vantage location with the Line 1 vaporetto (waterbus) sailing straight from the entrance to Venice to the Ca'Rezzonico station at the hotel door. Also from the hotel pier you may enjoy the traghetto (cross-over) of the Grand Canal to Palazzo Grassi and back by gondolone. Whereas a 40 minute tour by gondola will set you back 80 euros, the gondolone costs 0.50 â‚¬ one way - yes, you read right 0.50 not 50. In Venice there are 7 other traghetti across the Grand Canal â€“ 8 crossings for 4 â‚¬. The Swiss millionaire Frau Stern decorated the late medieval structure of the hotel building with Venetian renaissance and other elements, blending them with exquisite taste (photos 34, 35, 36, 37). We hired a charming junior suite (photo 37b) with side-view on the Canal Grande (photo 38). You may enhance the hotel experience of an aristocratic mansion by visiting the larger Ca'Rezzonico palace museum, just one bridge away. The Palazzo Stern is situated in the Dorsoduro sestier, an authentic Venice neighbourhood, less overwhelmed by tourists but still in the heart of the city. The price is reasonable for the hotel's standing and location. Thanks to Hotel Stern and its staff for an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “For those who have not seen Venice at its best”
Reviews.Author: William D
Reviews.Content: From the vaporetto we saw the guests having breakfast on a sunny terrace The hotel looked so charming, we jumped off the boat at the next stop to have a closer look. This was a few years ago. Just last week we finally made it back to Venice. We had five memorable days at the Palazzo Stern. Our room left nothing to be desired except a view on the canal. For that, reserve well in advance. The only other regret was that despite the splendid sunshine, November is a bit too chilly for breakfasting on the terrace. The hotel has, I think, the most beautiful facade on the Grand Canal. Its interior is a work of art. The location is ideal for getting around the city: the vaporetto â€“the worldâ€™s most enjoyable public transportation,in my opinionâ€”stops just nearby. A gondola will take you directly across the canal for 50 centimes to the Palazzo Grassi and beyond. As for restaurants, itâ€™s difficult to eat badly in Italy. The welcome is warm, the staff, the service, irreproachable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for my birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: j_e_heath
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Venice, my husband's second. He chose the hotel, a junior suite with canal view which was just lovely. Morning sunshine with views of the Accademia Bridge and Peggy Guggenheim Museum (fab) just minutes away. Vaporetto stop Ca'Rezzonico a few feet away. All staff so very friendly and helpful, thank you. A good size terrace on the canal side for photos - a bit too chilly to sit out at this time of year. Buffet breakfast, very good. Cleanliness, absolutely no complaints. An unexpected bottle of fizz appeared in our room on my birthday. This hotel is small but perfectly formed. A little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLaS
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely, small hotel right on the Grand Canal. We stayed in Room 304 (junior suite) overlooking the Grand Canal. This was very spacious with all of the amenities you would expect in a top rate hotel. Bathroom was particularly good. Coffee machines still not working! Always coffee or tea available free, though, so no problem. There is a wonderful terrace and an excellent bar. All the staff were extremely good. I've stayed in Venice about 9 times in 6 different hotels and this is definitely the best yet. Will be going back soon, I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mewilson2
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel overlooking the canal. Quite. Beautiful room. Coffee machine not working but we were given free coffee when we wanted it. Good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I would stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel right on the Grand Hotel and right next to a vaporetto stop. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Our junior suite overlooked the Grand Hotel and was very spacious with all of the amenities you would expect in a top rate hotel. There is a wonderful open air patio right on the Grand Canal where you can enjoy your breakfast or a drink in the evening. John & Margot H. Bloomfield Hills, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: hetha77
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 5 nights at the Hotel Palazzo Stern. The hotel is gorgeous and retains the charm of the palazzo it was until fairly recently. We had a standard room on the second floor - average size and beautifully decorated. Lovely bathroom with jacuzzi bath. Unfortunately our coffee machine was broken, but we were offered free coffee from the helpful staff, if we wanted it. All staff on the front desk were very helpful, wonderfully friendly and a pleasure to talk to. One of the younger front desk staff recommended some lovely restaurants to us, and was particularly pleasant. The area is fantastic - not too touristy at all and with some great local restaurants nearby - we had extremely enjoyable meals at Do Farai, La Bitta and Ristoteca Oniga as well as enjoying drinks in the lively campo st margherita very close by and cicchetti at an enoteca near the shore - Enoteca Gia Schiavi. I would highly recommend the hotel, and visiting Venice in November - non of the crowds or terrible food you read about. I would say that we were probably the youngest people staying there and it was very quiet - which is what we were looking for in a hotel, wanting to have a relaxing break. However the campo nearby had several lively bars frequented by italian students, if we wanted a night out... One tiny negative - which was pretty small so we did not bother to mention - coffee at breakfast tasted like instant coffee, not good italian coffee. Perhaps ask for a cappucino or macchiatone if like us you prefer good coffee - I noticed one getntleman doing this on the last morning!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Necee
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful property. And the location is only outdone by the terrific staff. Can't imagine staying anywhere else.They helped with restaurant recommendations, arranged a water taxi to the airport at 6:30am. Even made us coffee and hot breakfast before we left. Genuine hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giroge
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful Staff, perfect location, nice and comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: MARKASouthport
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as it was a special trip for my 50th birthday. We had a junior suite with a canal view,as you look at the front of the hotel its the top right hand window. The room had twin beds which was a bit of a disappointment but we lived with it. The room was spotless as was the bathroom and as was the rest of the hotel. The hotel is a converted Palazzo and has retained many of its interesting features thankfully. There are chandeliers in most rooms and public areas and although not everyones cup of tea they do add a sense of grandeur to the place. The staff were impeccable,smart,well turned out, ever willing and wonderfully well mannered.To individualise them would be unfair as I didn't get everybody's name,so collectively they were first rate. Breakfast was everything that was required and as much or as little as one wanted. If I had one minor quibble it would be that our coffee machine in our room was broken so when we required a drink we had to ring room service,there was no charge for this and there was never a problem but they could have just put a kettle in and we would've made our own happily,but this was a minor,very minor issue. This hotel is not cheap but you do get what you pay for in this circumstance.If you want something special you could do a lot worse than the Pallazzo Stern.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palazzo Stern Venice”
Reviews.Author: Trewedna
Reviews.Content: This Hotel exceeded all expectations. The staff were brilliant and so helpful.We chose the"Stern" as a special treat for our 25th wedding anniversary and it will live on in our memory as one of the best.The location was excellent on the Grand Canal near a vaporetto point but also within walking distance of all main attractions.The room was a junior suite with two windows/balconies overlooking the Grand Canal,you could spend hours just watching from the room.Breakfast was also a treat not just the food but sitting at your table right next to the water.I really cannot extol the virtues of this hotel too much.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: Andree M
Reviews.Content: Stunning architecture and decor; warm, friendly, overly-accommodating staff; breathtaking views and location -- I cannot say enough good things about this incredible hotel and its staff! We spent two nights at Palazzo Stern (October 25 - 27, 2011) and from the moment we arrived to the moment we left, my best friend and I were treated like royalty! Upon learning we were celebrating my friend's birthday, we were immediately treated to a complimentary upgrade from a standard double room to a Junior Suite with a chilled bottle of Prosecco and a personalized birthday card waiting for my friend in the room (still trying to figure out how they did this so quickly)!! The room was something fit for Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt - cathedral ceilings, floor to ceiling windows with a view of the Grand Canal, oriental rugs, a bathroom the size of most hotel rooms - and amenities galore!! The room was immaculate and serviced to perfection twice a day. This was my friend's first trip to Italy and the experience was all the more unforgettable because of our stay at Palazzo Stern! Our heartfelt thanks to the staff for their wonderful hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel - tasteful, stylish, luxurious charm”
Reviews.Author: daftpuddin
Reviews.Content: Where do you begin to describe this beautiful place - the location, building, rooms, service? Celebrated my birthday whilst here, and the hotel gave us a beautiful room overlooking side canal, courtyard garden and Grand Canal to one side. The interiors are so tastefully luxurious - huge Murano chandelier, wall lights and wall mirror, spa bath, even the wall coverings were of a slighly padded fabric which matched the magnificent curtains. The terrace is fantastic - we had coffee and drinks here in the autumn sunshine, watching the world go by on the Grand Canal and pretending not to notice all the people on the vaparettos and taxis pointing and taking pictures of the hotel (and us!). Some of the delightful little touches - a bottle of bubbly on ice, generously given by the hotel at no cost, to help celebrate my birthday. Little notes left in room giving next day's weather forecast , also one to remind us to put our clocks back at end of October. The surrounding area is Venice at its best - for such a central location its relatively quiet and chance to mingle with local residents as they go about their business. Best meal we had was at a superb restaurant (Avogaria) found on the street about a few hundred metres directly behind the hotel - just keep walking past the busy little piazza, the restaurants seem to get better and better the further you walk from the Grand Canal. I'm trying hard to find things about this hotel which could be improved. Perhaps breakfast tables could be cleared a bit faster but this is compensated by the following experience which seems to typify this place. At our first breakfast we wanted soft boiled eggs (which you can cook yourself or get staff to do for you - its not a common breakast dish in continental Europe), and found all the egg cups had been used. On the following morning, the waiter came to our table and produced an egg cup from his pocket which he'd saved specially for us. All done in very good humour. I've been to Venice three times previously and after our experience at Pallazzo Stern would now not stay anywhere else but here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware....”
Reviews.Author: MrsB1000
Reviews.Content: I have written a review before for this hotel as visited last December and loved it. It was somewhat marred this July when they tried to bill us again for our 3 night stay......7 months later. On arrival we had given them our hotel voucher so thought no more of it. Luckily the credit company refunded us as I had kept proof of purchase from the May 2010 when booked. The hotel were not helpful as I rang and sent emails asking what had happened and they could not even bother to reply. Very sad as I would love to visit this hotel again,but this experience has now ruined it. KEEP ALL RECEIPTS OF PROOF OF HOLIDAY PURCHASE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, lovely decor, very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “every thing we hoped!!!”
Reviews.Author: leostargirl
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel, after finding it on tripadvisor went with friends,, couldn't half been happier, loved the location, staff is wonderful,,, the hotel it self, is very beautiful, bathrooms are so lovey, with italian tiles and all new fittings, had jetted tub in ours,,,we were on the side facing the small canal, very charming,,drinks at night in the bar were amazing because of Erica, the BEST bartender ever!!!!! this was a 5 star experience!!!! Eileen ,NY

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: Elles M
Reviews.Content: Right next to the waterstop Ca Reccioni, palazzo Stern is ideally located at the grand canal. The service was impeccable. The palazzo itself doesn't have the grandeur of f.i. palazzo Danieli, but makes up for it with comfortable rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Venice”
Reviews.Author: tom t
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place to stay in Venice. Prices in Venice are expensive but if you wan the experience of being on the canal the prices are going to be high. After researching several of the hotels on the canal we found the Palazzo Stern to be the best price. The holel is a gem. It has an old feel with everything new. The restoration that was done on the hotel 5 years ago is amazing. You cannot walk away from this hotel and have a bad comment. The rooms are tastefully done in venetian decor. We went for the jr. suite that was on the canal and we had a balcony. Some of the rooms on the canal may not have a balcony but they have very tall french doors that open, you just dont step out. The jr. suite rooms are very large, and comfortable and spotless. Some of the rooms have tubs with handheld showers and some have shower heads but smaller tubs. The staff is very friendly and efficient. If I called for something, they were at my door before I hung up the phone. There are only about 24 rooms so you are treated special. The breakfast was served in a lovely room off the bar and had many selections. They have a wonderful balcony for breakfast but unfortunately we were there in Oct and it was too cold to eat out there. However, the hotel set the tables each morning with tablecloths so if a guest wanted to go out there and sit with a glass of wine or a snack they were welcome to. Everyday the tables were set with fresh linens even if the weather was cold. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting venice. It was convenitently located with several restaurants right behind the hotel. Having the Vaperatto stop right at the hotel is convenient. I will be returning to the Palazzo Stern the next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinKidd
Reviews.Content: Good hotel right in front of the Grand Canal. It is so conviently located next to a water ferry stop, although we arrived by water taxi which was lovely start to the holiday. On arrival they provided us with a small welcome drink which was a nice touch. The hotel had a small bar which was nice. However, it did not have its own restaurant which was a bit strange, although the hotel did provide us with recommendations of local places to eat. Before we went I thought I read reviews saying there was a hot tub on the roof. There was no mention of this in the welcome pack left in our room, so I am still not sure if they had one or not. Our room was nice & decorated very well. The hotel did offer us a free trip to Murano which was worth taking, they took us there in a private water taxi & we made our own way back.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: raymon7746
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite facing the Grand Canal. The room was excellent. It was of good size and exceptionally decorated with a bath room with separate shower and bath. Breakfast was very good and served in a room next to the bar. It was a little too chilly to have breakfast on the patio which was also very nice. The patio overlooks the Canal and is a good spot for a cocktail before dinner. The location was perfect for what we wanted to see in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: praktikrambla
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel you can choose in Venezia, right in front of the Grand Canal, walking distance from Everything in Venecia and everywhere. I booked it and organise everything to ask my girlfriend's hand and everything went perfect!!!! Domenico, Manuel, the hotel manager Roberto and all the staff was involved and made everything to go perfect. the restaurant they booked for us, the boat to go there, the room service on the way back... everything was in the right place at the right time, it was like a dream come true. If I ever go back to Venice, this will be my hotel. Thanks everybody for your help and for being profesional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, our treat of a hotel to finish a trip!”
Reviews.Author: WhirlygirlAnne
Reviews.Content: After doing a whirlwind trip through Italy, this hotel was our last stop of 10 days. By far the best (and most expensive). The treatment by the staff was top notch. Our room wasn't ready for us when we arrived around 2pm (I think officially check in is 3 or 4p), however, we were able to take care of the paperwork, leave our luggage and by the time we got back, they had put our luggage in our rooms. It was my friend's birthday so I arranged to have a bottle of prosecco waiting for us. When they discovered that it was her birthday (lost in translation on the phone), they offered us another bottle free of charge. Though from what I understand you have to pay to use the hot on the terraza up top, they had no problem at least letting you take a peak from the roof, which, if you want some great photos, time that visit for sunset - the view is spectacular. It was a added bonus that after I had booked this hotel room I happened to watch the movie "The Italian Job" (the newer one with Ed Norton) and realized that the "house" they robbed is the buliding this hotel now occupies. The interior is incredibly beautiful and charming - thank goodness for a 4 gig data card - because I took many photos of the hotel alone. While it is pricy, this is Venice and booking 4 months out, for anything on the canal and somewhat charming you are going to pay around 300USD a night, so if you have it in your budget, splurge for this place. Also, it is so conviently located next to a water ferry stop, that you gain nothing by taking a water taxi from the train station, save the money and take the ferry. The breakfast that comes with the room was quite nice, so that is an added bonus as well.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: JCOOVERT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights. The first night (room #303) we had a room on the side canal. The windows were so high that we couldn't see the canal, but people in the building next door could see right into our room so we had to keep the drapes closed. The bathtub wall was over three feet high preventing my wife from having a bath/shower. The last three nights we were in a tiny room (#502). The management turned off the HVAC to the entire hotel. It was so hot in our room that we had to open the windows, and were eaten alive by mosquitos. Management gave us a lame excuse stating that the HVAC was turned off because some guests complained about it being too cold. Odd statement because both of our rooms had individual controls. We concluded that management was just trying to save money. Buyer beware. It's a great location, but the rooms and management are terrible. And it's got a four star rating. Absurd!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive but WOW !”
Reviews.Author: MorrisDf
Reviews.Content: The best address in Venice !! We stayed in a suite with a grande canal view , it was amazing. The room had a jet bath and beautiful bathroom . Breakfast wasn't the greatest but it was fine. The hotel is 50 m from water taxi stop, but walking to St Marks is much more interesting . It's about a 15 min walk through the old streets of Venice .

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay when in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: I very rarely write reviews, but our stay at the Palazzo Stern at the end of July was so good that I just had to share some of our experiences so others will put this hotel to the top of their list when looking for somewhere to stay in Venice. Not wanting to be caught out by bad restaurant experiences when staying in Venice we tried hard to identify great places to eat (highly recommend the Venice Osterie book, and alla Staffa was a simply brilliant find). The hotel were only too happy to book our chosen restaurants, and quickly replied to my email requests. One of these booking requests happened to mention that it as my 40th birthday on the 25th July. The hotel picked up on this and arranged for a chilled bottle of wine to be waiting for us in our room when we got back from a hard days walking. When we sat down at the bar upon our return they bought it down so we could enjoy it on their fantastic terrace overlooking the Grand Canel. It's this sort of attention to detail that made the Pallazzo Stern the only hotel we would consider when we go back to Venice. On a practical more note, the staff were all very cheerful and helpful; our room was beautifully finished; and breakfast on the terrace with that view was to die for. And, as we came to appreciate, the stop for the water bus was right door- VERY convenient when you've got to get the station with luggage. My only suggestion would be for more coffee in the bedroom. But in the great scheme of things that's barely worth a mention.

Reviews.Title: “sheer luxury in wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: pjbchapman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day stay in a junior suite with canal view [room406 ] Following a very bad experience in a 5 star hotel in venice last year we cannot say how very different our stay was at Pallazzo Stern .From the minute we stepped off the water taxi we knew this hotel was very special.The staff were professional and helpful the building outstanding with large beautifuly decorated bedroom and the highlight of breakfast on the terrace in the sunshine overlooking the grand canal.The only negative thing was that the coffee maker did not work in the room but this in no way spoilt the holiday. The situation is ideal away from the busy tourist areas yet within easy walking of all the sites We had excellent value, evening meals at local restaurants, some recommended and booked by hotel staff. If you want a special pre or post dinner drink forget Harry's bar and hop over to Giudecca on the vaporetta and visit the Skyline Bar in The Hilton ....the views over Venice are spectacular .Thankyou to all the staff at Palazzo Stern for restoring our faith in hotels in Venice and for making our holiday so special. We will be back and perhaps next time we may be lucky enough to get room 405 with balcony !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and beasts..”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: Staying in a real palazzo in Venice is a bit like going back in time where one wants to put on smart clothing and wear a mask from time to time. Palazzo Stern gives you this feeling with its extra ordinary interior, staircase and obviously the view from its terrace. Breakfast with awe and delicious croissants .. can one ask for more. Still: we came away with a few remarks and we still physically feel the hotel.. The reason: the mosquitos.. and a lot of them! We stayed four nights and every morning we were covered with bites, sometimes spending time in the bathroom during the night to stop the itching. We of course mentioned this to the staff and ask the room to be sprayed - but obviously without result. Than there was the bar service, or rather the lack of it. Coming home after a long day admiring the city we just wanted a glass of wine and enjoy the view. After a (long) while we were asked by a very unfriendly lady if we were staying at the hotel - which we were. Without the opportunity to ask two glasses of wine she disappeared to serve another table with 4 people to never return. A bit desperate we left to the room to get dressed for the evening concert, after which we thought we give the bar a second change. A grappa on the terrace at night is a romantic event, not? So we arrived at the terrace around 11 PM to be told the bar was closed; no more drinks. After some strong persuation we eventually got a glass of wine (still pretty expensive..) and finally enjoyed the quiet of the evening - and after that back to the mosquitos. Did we enjoy Venice? Of course! Is Palazzo Stern a good hotel? Of course .. but perfection lies in the detail and here we noticed a lack of it. The concierge is supposed to know if one can buy tickets for San Marco in advance and not point us to the internet terminal upstairs.. since the WiFi is not working.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: mg788
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the best hotel we have ever stayed in, not because of any luxury inclusions, but due to a combination of an unbeatable location on the Grand Canal, welcoming staff, and an atmosphere conducive to relaxation and exploration. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Stern provides a luxurious and welcoming stay for ou visit.”
Reviews.Author: DianaandMike
Reviews.Content: The hotel captures vintage interiors with modern convenience. The room was large and the bath sumptuous. The convenient location at the Ca' Rezzonico stop made getting around Venice a breeze. The breakfast buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TamaraAnne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful four night stay at Palazzo Stern. By far one of the most beautiful hotel rooms we have ever slept in. Everything was perfect, right down to the Murano glass chandelier, amazing view of the Grand Canal and the luxurious bath. It is very conveniently located, only steps from the Ca' Rezzonico vaporetto stop. The staff were all very helpful and gracious. Breakfast is tasty and very generous. If the weather is fine you can sit on the the terrace and watch the boats go by. Just a few things to note: If you are a light sleeper, the noise from the canal WILL wake you, if you aren't an early riser. It starts about seven am, and gets progressively more noisy. We didn't mind at all, I loved the boats and we were getting up anyway. But if you had a late night, you may wish for a room on the other side. The only real disappointment we had was that drinks in the bar were very expensive for what you received. It wasn't the price that was disappointing, Venice is not a budget city, and most 4 star places get a premium for drinks. The issue was how stingy they were when pouring. We're not big drinkers, but we don't like being shamelessly fleeced, either. That might explain why the bar/terrace was always empty in the evenings, despite the gorgeous location. If you want to sit there and enjoy an after dinner drink, I recommend having a coffee. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel. Just buy a bottle of cognac and enjoy it in your beautiful room. Or better yet, make a bubble bath and sip it in there!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, tasty breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal - what could be better? This hotel exceeded our expectations and we would certainly stay there again. Made use of the jacuzzi on the roof terrace with spectacular views. Central location between St Mark's Square and The Rialto. Lots of bars and restaurants near by. Don't look anywhere else - just book here - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonJacM
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel to stay in, especially for a first visit. Staff were very attentive, and the breakfast on the waterside terrace was a real treat. Very convenient location with easy access via water bus to the entire city and other islands, but in a less crowded and nice neighborhood area.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at Palazzo Stern”
Reviews.Author: ellenwoodoff
Reviews.Content: Our second stay in two years to this beautiful and well-located hotel on the Grand Canal was even more wonderful than our first. The friendly and helpful staff assisted us by getting great seats to La Traviata at La Teatro Fenice. The terrace party for the annual historical Regatta was great fun. And the close proximity to so many great places of interest in a quiet area of Venice made it the perfect place for us. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, but..”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: In all honesty i expected a little more from the hotel following the great rating on Trip Advisor. The room was beautifully furnished, lovely bed and pleaseant bathroom but ultimately it was small and perhaps i would go as far as to say cramped. The side canal view isnt worth getting excited about. The terrace is fantastic, the breakfast pretty good and service not bad. I cant call this hotel average but for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon i had hoped for more. I dont expect amercian "have a nice day" service but would suggest roberto spends a little more time talking to guests in the hotel than replying to trip advisor comments - in three days nobody said congrats or introduced themselves . im not expecting the red carpet or anything but it took understated/quiet to borderline rude.
