I cant discourage people from staying here as the location is great, the terrace wonderful and its a top place to chill out from the madness. i think the dire state of sterling probably makes it feel more expensive than it actually is. In summary for us, a very good hotel but somewhat impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 211Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel with very helpful staff. Good breakfast choice. Very nice decor. Location very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of Italian history (with treats for any movie buff!)”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryNiki
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely nothing negative I can say about our stay at the Stern. Had I planned more in advance, however, I would have know that the local water bus stops at the hotel's doorstep (instead we paid the â‚¬60 euro for a water taxi). If you are arriving in Venice by train, get on the water bus at the train station traveling east. For â‚¬6.50, the water bus will take you to the Ca'Rezzonico stop, literally at the entrance to the Palazzo Stern. Something else I found out about the Palazzo Stern after we arrived that this hotel has had it's 15 minutes of Hollywood fame! Movie buffs may remember the Venice robbery scene from "The Italian Job"? Well, the Palazzo Stern is that building! The hotel was recently renovated - after the movie was filmed - but also has a history as an art gallery with the impressive architecture and murals to prove it. (Want another Hollywood tidbit? Just 20 steps from the hotel is the famous church from "Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Arc" where Harrison Ford smashes through the floor to find rats, fire, and a dead Crusader. Of course the church looks different on the inside, but if you're a fan of the movie than it's worth taking your picture in front of). The beauty of this hotel is undeniable. We stayed in the suite with the front balcony, seeable upon arrival. Popping corks of champagne into the Grand Canal was unforgettable! Knowing it was our honeymoon, staff sent us a bottle of champagne and a single rose upon our arrival. Rooms are perfectly clean and the staff are very helpful. Restaurants in the area are great (try Al Vecio Marangon, just around the corner - the food is amazing at a great price.) The Stern is close enough to San Marco's that you can walk to the square but it's far enough away that you can get away from the tourist chaos and retreat to the peacefulness and beauty of the hotel! If there is one warning I could suggest, it is to be weary of the hotel's suggestion for you to visit Murano. Staff told us we could use the hotel's boat to visit the island - this, of course, is a sales pitch. The driver will take you to one factory on the island where you will be heavily pressured into buying blown glass worth more than a years worth of tuition. If you're brave enough to endure the sales pitch, then a free ride to one of the cities tourist attractions may be worth it (like I said, it costs â‚¬60 to get around in a private taxi). However, if you're a meeker creature like me than it might be worth your while to avoid the uncomfortable situation. The Palazzo Stern was a highlight of our Italy trip and made our stay in Venice unforgettable. You will literally be surrounded by history from the moment you wake up to the moment you go to bed. From Hollywood stars, to famous historical characters (Casanova was born in the yellow building right across the canal), to the hotel itself; when you stay at the Stern you will literally be a part of history.

Reviews.Title: “A gem, perfect as always, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: cohenfamily
Reviews.Content: My third time at the Palazzo Stern. It is always a treat. The location is wonderful. Away from the madness of St Marco. Close enough to the the Academia Bridge to head anywhere. Right on the vaparetto line. In a wonderful area. Great breakfast buffet. The hotel has so many beautiful details it is like a small museum. The rooms are beautiful. A true treasure.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: snainton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Stern in August on the first leg of our month in Italy, and what a wonderful choice we made. We arrived by water taxi (100 Euros and highly recommended), straight to the hotels private water jetty and were greeted by the staff and given some refreshment. We had booked a family room overlooking the Grand Canal it was very spacious and very well decorated. The staff attended to every need even bringing us a pot of tea to the room on an afternoon. The children enjoyed the chocolate on their pillow every night and the sweets in reception!!! The breakfast is buffet style and is one of the best we have had, you can either eat inside or sit on the terrace with a wonderful view of the canal. The hotel is in a wonderful position, close to all the attractions but away from the hustle and bustle. We look forward to visiting the Palazzo Stern again, we highly recommend it, not least because of the wonderful gift of a cookery book that we received on our last night - Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “I would not change a thing!”
Reviews.Author: Bologna_Bullet
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was on a side canal thus avoiding the Grand Canal and it had a very small balcony unlike most rooms. Staff were very polite, helpful and spoke excellent English. The room was clean, modern, tidy and had a lot squeezed into a small foot print. The coffee machine was broken but we were told to call room service to have coffee brought to our room free of charge - although we did not test this out. The hotel is right next to a Vaporetto stop on line 1 - this is very handy. Get yourself a travel card and use the Vaporetto to navigate the Grand Canal - which is a great boat trip in itself. If you get lost, get get back to the Grand Canal and you can find this hotel. 10 mins by Vaporetto is the hurly burly of St marks Square - we were glad that we were no closer. Whilst you should visit that area, it is very busy! Breakfast on the Grand Canal was superb and set us up for the day. Would not hesitate to recommend to anyone - we chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor comments.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: sjf5104
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Palazzo Stern. A beautiful hotel with really friendly and helpful staff. Our room was luxurious and spacious and we booked a junior suite overlooking the Grand Canal which was well worth the extra cost. When we arrived we found that we had the only room which had a balcony which was an added bonus and was superb as the views from the balcony were spectacular. Losts of good restaurants within walking distance. An excellent place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Lindaw143
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine a more perfect location - 10 steps from Ca Rezzonico vaporetti stop, on the Grand Canal. The rooms are very comfortable, though the sheets were surprisingly rough (looked lovely though!). We had a standard room with no tub. The staff are politely helpful. They are not the sort that anticipates your needs. Want a drink at the bar? No problem, but you'll have to search for the staff. More coffee at breakfast? Just ask and it'll arrive - but you won't be asked! I was surprised to see others got welcome drinks. We didn't, even though we arrived at lunchtime. Hmmm. One quibble - they have the standard "hotspot" internet access like most places. An 8 digit username & password you have to keep inputting. I wish they extended the range to the terrace. It would be so easy to do but the signal is slow everywhere except right next to the computer on the 2nd floor! Best location ever!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific luxury value”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLaJolla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Stern for 9 nights in August, more than enough time to discover all the strengths and weaknesses of the hotel. The strengths are many, as detailed by other reviewers here, so there's no need for me to repeat them. We found no weaknesses at all. This is a wonderful small luxury property at an amazingly low price for everything you receive during a stay. The staff is pleasant, courteous, and always ready to respond to wishes and requests. Our room (402) was so clean it sparkled, very comfortable, and with a sweet Venice view even though it was only a "standard" room and not directly facing the Grand Canal. Breakfast was plentiful, with many choices of excellent breads, pastries, fruits, meats, cereals, yogurt, and even scrambled eggs and bacon. Over the course of four multi-week visits to Venice in the last few years, we've stayed in three of the top-ten-rated hotels on TripAdvisor. Loved them all, but this was the most luxurious and the greatest value for our money. The terrace on the Grand Canal is priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning. The rooms are elegant and the hotel overlooks the grand canal. It is lovely to have breakfast with this spectacular view. The food is great, (very tasty with a good choice) and the staff are exceptional- friendly, helpful and efficient. The location is perfect, a short walk to the best galleries, museums and a water bus stop if you do not fancy walking or getting a taxi. We had never been to Venice before and came on our honeymoon. The staff welcomed us and carefully explained how to navigate the city and where the best places were to visit. We had a lovely time here and would love to go back and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily9923
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Venice at this Hotel. The Hotel was great and the staff warm and welcoming. The location was perfect, all in all a memorable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: illinoisjack
Reviews.Content: Stunning, refined hotel, friendly helpful staff. The staff recommended a great restaurant. Breakfast on the terrance was sao beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joan C
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern was a wonderful boutique hotel. We found the staff exceedingly helpful. Our room was clean, comfortable, and nicely furnished. This hotel has exquiste architectural decoration and detail. The outdoor veranda/patio is great for breakfast, drinking, or just relaxing, As we took the vaporetto up and down the canal, we did not see any other hotel with such a well maintained and beautiful place to sit and view Venice traffic! The vaporetto stop is right outside making travel very easy. Venice was our favorite city on our Italy tour and this was our favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy palace”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandJosh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is richly appointed and elegant, but cozy and comfortable as well. The location is perfect, right on the Grand Canal, steps from the Water Bus stop. As accessible as the hotel is to all important destinations,it is insulated from the hustle and bustle of touristic Venice. It is indeed an ideal refuge. The service is responsive and helpful. Breakfest selection is great and is served in a terrace overlooking the Canal, or in a beautiful dining room. We stayed 3 days in this hotel-- it was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Supermac01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic find. Set in the 'slightly quieter' Dorsoduro area of Venice, it is a 20 minute walk to St Mark's square and has lots of great bars and restaurants within a stone's throw. The hotel is beautiful and sits on the Grand Canal. We noticed a number of tourists taking pictures of the outside of the building as they took their gondola/taxi rides on the water. We stayed in a junior suite which was perfect. We had recently married in Lake Garda and on arrival a card and a bottle of very nice prosecco awaited us. It was a good-sized room with comfortable beds, arm chairs and an old chimney in the corner of the room. Felt a little bit like staying in a castle. The bathroom was very sparkly with a separate shower and bath. The staff in the hotel were very attentive, although I would say that the boys who wait at breakfast time appeared to need more help as they seemed rushed off their feet at times. As our coffee machine was broken we were told to call down to reception for hot drinks. This was never a problem and coffee was always brought up within a few minutes. We paid around 300 euros a night - which was much less than the hotel's currently advertised rate. Having spent 2 weeks in Lake Garda I thought this represented excellent value for money. The only problem we had was the noise from the canal (starting at around 6am) - however this is probably to be expected if you want a canalside location. An excellent hotel - highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Harryst999
Reviews.Content: From the very helpful and friendly staff to the comfy and clean room everything is thought about in hotel palazzo stern. We arrived and were warmly greeted with information and drinks and were taken up to our spacious room with a view few hotels could match. Each day the room was cleaned twice with a sweet and a weather card left on the pillow and the hotel was beautiful the one pet peeves I had were not about the hotel but about how crowded the Rialto bridge and ST marks square was but apart from that it was near perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Dorsoduro”
Reviews.Author: mrjlindy
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this Hotel. It was on par with our stays at the Bauer or Monaco minus the annoying crowds of San Marco. The staff (especially Manuel) was extremely helpful and we enjoyed our stay so much we are planning to return in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful setting and superb service by the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: IKJ
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, wonderful location and fantastic rooms. I genuinely enjoyed staying in this hotel more than any other I have visited, whether they have had a better star rating or not. As for tips - the hotel door is next to the Ca' Rezonicca stop on Vaporetto line 1 - that is the easiest and most cost efficient way to arrive and get around (a bus from the airport costs 5 euros to Venice centre and is easy to find if you do not wish to pay nonsensical amounts for a water taxi and wait too long for a public waterbus from the airport). The wifi was free in the hotel but not advertised - I just had to ask and was given a password. The terrace is wonderful as a place to eat breakfast but pigeons are everywhere in Venice and have probably used your cutlery before you arrive! Get some fresh from the buffet bar inside but don't miss eating outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Judith05715
Reviews.Content: Staying at Palazzo Stern Hotel was a fabulous choice for our first trip to Venice. The hotel is conveniently located next to the Ca Rezzonico vaporetto stop on line 1 and so was very easy to find. The hotel was until about 2008, a private residence. It is now a beautiful hotel with only 17 rooms. The rooms are very well decorated and furnished and as a bonus, they are airconditioned. This is notable as July was very hot in Europe! The bathrooms and other amenities are excellent. The front terrace is set up as a wonderful location for breakfast or drinks and overlooks the Grand Canal.The service was exemplary - for instance while we were checking in we were brought a glass of orange juice each which was greatly appreciated after a long day of travel. Our luggage was also whisked to our room by a porter as we were given a short tour of the hotel while being shown to our room. The hotel contains beautiful artworks, floor mosaics and glass chandeliers. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kim54917
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here in June. We absolutely cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel! From the minute we arrived, with 5 large suitcases, we were treated like special guests. Our porter would not let us help at all with our bags, which after 10 days in Europe, was a welcome break! He brought us juice while we checked in, and then brought our bags to us. We reserved 2 rooms, which were both spacious and luxurious! The bathrooms were beautiful with large tubs and great shower heads! Bathroom amenities were provided daily, as well as a welcome bottle of Presecco on our arrival. There were 2 queen beds in each room, and an additional cot was brought in for our children's room. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job keeping our rooms clean and neat. With 3 children in one room, that was sometimes a challenge, but the room always well cleaned. We had gorgeous grand canal view rooms, which made it a delight to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. We also enjoyed cocktails and snacks every afternoon on the fabulous front patio area right on the grand canal. We ate breakfast on the patio every morning as well. The food was wonderful, with a large selection of hot and cold foods. Our children loved the breakfast at this hotel better than any other hotel we stayed in during our 3 weeks in Europe. The location of the hotel was very convenient to many attractions, including St. Mark's, but not so convenient that we were surrounded by tourists and lots of noise. The staff was very helpful with any directions, reservations or questions we had. Our whole family was truly able to relax and enjoy our time in Venice. We will definitely stay here on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “My expectations were exceeded in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: klinzer
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully decorated and the hotel is kept up very well. The bathrooms are very clean and look new. The hotel staff has been very accommodating. Breakfast was excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the rooms, the location and the atmosphere...but...”
Reviews.Author: Suderman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 2 sons stayed at the Hotel Palazzo Stern for 3 nights in July. We had to get 2 separate rooms. We loved the rooms (smallish for North American standards and decadent - on the larger side for European standards) - the decor was lovely, the rooms well appointed and clean. We loved the history of the building and the fact that they kept the core-structure during renovation. The front desk staff were outstanding and very helpful. Our only complaint there was that they sent us to a restaurant for dinner that was advertised on their hotel map... and we were not treated well at that restaurant. But I think that's just Venice. Not the greatest customer service overall, anywhere. The only problem we had with the hotel was the wait-staff in the restaurant - especially during breakfast. Either the people they hire for the morning shift aren't well trained, or they just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “First night of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: blevey85
Reviews.Content: After taking a 3-hour train, 45-minute taxi, 7-hour flight, 2-hour flight, 45-minute bus ride, and a 30-minute boat bus ride we arrived at the Hotel Palazzo Stern. From the moment we sat down in the lobby we were treated like kings and could relax and enjoy our stay in Venice. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and there is no other place I would stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenIW
Reviews.Content: Our room was fabulous. It was huge and luxurious with chandeliers, beautiful drapes, and an ornate antique carved bed headboard. The bed was enormous and the bathroom was modern and beautiful. It was spotlessly clean and the air conditioning was very efficient and quiet. This hotel was originally a palace and had some amazing decorations in the hall areas. The hotel also has a beaurtiful terrace right on the grand canal-one of the few hotels in Venice with this. It was only a standard room but had some views of the Grand Canal which was great (Room 403) The location was convieniently right next to one of the waterbus stops. The only slight disappointments were that the breakfast buffet was quite basic and the drinks at the hotel bar were expensive (partly because the exchange rate of Â£sterling to Euro is so poor at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Nickynfreya
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter back to Venice to celebrate her 18th birthday. We booked a room with a view over the canal and it was just amazing. The room was enormous, very clean and although the one window was quite small it was full length and still gave a fantastic view over the canal. The hotel were very helpful, both wioth restaurant suggestions in the evening and booking a water taxi to get back to the airport. The breakfasts kept us going most of the day and the glass of prosecco on the terrace before dinner set us up for the evening. I will definitely be back. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lovestravel123
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to say enough about the Hotel Palazzo Stern and their staff. The hotel overlooks the grand canal and is easy to get to via a water taxi or the vaporetto (line 1, Ca Rezzonico stop). There is an outdoor patio overlooking the canal where you can eat breakfast or enjoy an evening glass of wine and watch the world go by. The staff was very friendly and seemed truly glad to be of service. My wife's luggage was somewhere between Frankfurt (thanks Lufthansa) and Venice and the staff made several calls on our behalf to the airline. An overall wonderful experience at a superb hotel. I would highly recommend the Palazzo Stern.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of character”
Reviews.Author: Hertsglobetrotter75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a short break at the Palazzo Stern to mark our 25th wedding aniversary. We were offered congratulations on our arrival but like a recent review, we did not get anything else. That said we had not chosen the hotel based upon expectations of a free bottle of wine, although some guests have appeared luckier than ourselves. The hotel does however offer character. We stayed on the first floor facing the canal and had an excellent view. The rooms were cleaned well and facilities were as advertised. The location is convenient to the waterbus and travelling around venice is easy, especially if you purchase a ticket covering the duration of your stay. The breakfast was identical on each of the three days of our stay and it was a pleasant start to the day to eat out on the terrace. Staff were helpful and polite. Overall we would recommend the hotel particularly for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AJSOT
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a delight and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is in a superb location and easy to get to with a Vaporetto stop right outside the entrance. We definitely plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathycnh
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at Hotel Palazzo Stern on July 2 and July 3. It is a lovely hotel, very upscale with all immenities included. We had access to internet and the breakfast was the best we had in Italy. Our room overlooked someone's beautiful courtyard. We were really impressed by the decor of the hotel; lovely lighting and furnishing. It is impressive. The room was not huge, but it was wonderful nonetheless. We prefer to see any city we are in by walking and you certainly do that in Venice. The location is a little far from the train station which made it very difficult to walk there. Do yourself a favor and take a water taxi (too pricey) or the vaporetto to the hotel. One of the few negative events of our trip was a person insisting on taking our suitcases across the bridge (something we would see in America, but without someone expecting to be paid for it). I am Italian by descent and that left a bad taste in my mouth. The person argued with my husband. We loved our week in Italy, but you almost have to pay to breathe there. Very expensive for an American right now.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Iisaa
Reviews.Content: It was a very ancient building, and it really matched with the spirit of the city! It was very well situated, and there was a vaporetto-bus station right next to the hotel entrance. The receptionnists were very nice, and they really tried to satisfy you. Unfortunately there was no restaurant in this hotel, but you could enjoy your excellent breakfast on the wonderful terrace right next to the canal.

Reviews.Title: “We Couldn't Have Asked For More”
Reviews.Author: Bret1991
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 20th anniversary. From the moment we walked through the door, everyone (the clerk at the front desk, waiters, bartenders, cleaning staff, etc.) was friendly and helpful. Our standard room was gorgeous, clean & comfortable and the cleaning staff did a great job each day. The room was a bit warm for sleeping, but I believe that's because the bedroom is on a separate floor from the sitting room and air conditioner. Nothing worth complaining about, just something to keep in mind if you're picky. Palazzo Stern is easy to find, just a few feet from the Ca' Rezzonico vaporetto stop. Get off the boat, look to your left, and you'll see the entrance. The terrace on the Grand Canal is a perfect place to relax on your first day in Venice or to eat breakfast. It's easy to get to San Marco (thanks to the close vaporetto stop), but far enough from the crowds. Walking through the local streets, you forget you're in a big city. It feels more like a series of small towns. We LOVED the Palazzo Stern. If we are fortunate to come back to Venice, this will be our first choice of hotels. My only regret is that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, clean, beautifully situated.”
Reviews.Author: Jippie83
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay, beatifull situated in the centre but very quite. Terrace and jacuzzi are marvalous. Personell is nice, and the rooms are very good and clean. Little minus was the coffee and orange juice at the breakfast. Not fresh, and from machine. The breakfast in total was good. We had the ground floor room, very nice with the balconne. Only thing thing is, you hear the phone and acitivty at te reception desk in the room. In total the stay was very good!! Have not seen a better hotel the whole stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: glynnbob
Reviews.Content: As it was our first trip to Venice we had looked at a number of hotels before deciding on staying at the Palazzo Stern and what a great choice it proved to be. The staff are all friendly and helpful and the hotel is a real gem. Situated close to a vaperotto stop it's very handy for arriving at the hotel & getting around on the Grand Canal. Breakfast (& a well earned drink after a days sightseeing) out on the terrace was a real treat. It was my birthday during the stay and the hotel suprised me with a bottle of prosseco - a lovely surprise. Overall it was a fantastic break, a wonderful hotel and we can't wait to go back! If you are going to Venice book this hotel you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFamily5
Reviews.Content: Our family had 2 rooms, a Junior Suite and a triple room. Both were good sized, well decorated, with nice bathrooms. The hotel staff was very helpful, lining up water taxis to the airport and suggesting nice restaurants. Rooms were clean. Overall impressions were very positive. The location is quiet but close to most city landmarks. Being located on the Grande Canal was nice as didn't have to transport our luggage over the cobblestone streets. Direct access to water taxis and the public transportation. The hotel is a little pricy but the buffet breakfast is excellent. Only issue we had was that the jacuzzi in our bathroom tub didn't work and the TV channels were limited (only 2 english speaking, CNN and BBC). But we didn't come to Venice to watch TV. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magical...”
Reviews.Author: MrsB1000
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day honeymoon at this hotel last December. Beautiful building complete with small chapel. Conveniently situated on canal with vaparetto stop right outside front door. Massive room with beautiful furnishings and fabulous bathroom complete with pink and gold tiles! Good breakfast and late night bar providing a warming grappa before going to bed. Would definately return to this hotel and Venice out of season again.

Reviews.Title: “magical stay”
Reviews.Author: laulat
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here as our first destination on honeymoon july 2010. As it was our honeymoon we splashed out and got a taxi boat from the airport. This in itself was really exciting and enjoyable and gave u a feel for venice. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly staff (forgive me I forgot his name because it was nearly a year ago). We were given some lovely cool orange juice and welcomed to the hotel, The room was amazing, don't think we've ever stayed somewhere so nice. You caouldn't see out onto the grand canal but there were skylightwindows so you still saw the sunshine and heard the hustle and bustle outside.Breakfast was buffet style, staff were extremely helpful, good location and we thoroughly enjoyed our 3 nights in venice at palazzo stern.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at palazzo stern”
Reviews.Author: fam2292
Reviews.Content: my wife and I spent 5 days in Venice at Palazzo Stern in June. The location is great, the hotel and rooms are wonderful and clean. Service was also great, a special thx to Daniel who helped us with different tips on the city during our trip. We really enjoyed Venice and the Palazzo

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WLondon77
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us 2 nights here at the start of our honeymoon, and I don't think he could have picked somewhere more beautiful. We had the warmest of welcomes when we arrived late in the evening, and I was then surprised by chilled prosecco and a huge vase of peonies in the room which he had organised with the extremely helpful staff. The whole hotel is beautiful - our room was airy, elegant yet comfortable and enjoying the wonderful buffet breakfast on the terrace in the mornings was a lovely way to start the day. This hotel isn't cheap, but everything else about it is perfect, and that comes at a price.. A lovely treat

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic Grand Canal location”
Reviews.Author: boloca
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Palazzo Stern was simply amazing. We loved the history of the Palazzo, the accomodating staff, the amazing large room overlooking the Canal with every possible amenity! They paid great attention to detail when refurbishing the hotel. It was so great being right near the Ca'Rezzonica Vaporetto stop...made getting around so easy. The Dorsoduro area where Palazzo Stern is located is a lovely neighborhood as well. We so enjoy the morning breakfast buffets outside along the canal watching the world go by. Evening cocktails there were spectacular as well. It definitely made this our third trip to Venice even more memorable!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Canadian7068
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Stern May 26 and 27. We looked a bit travel weary after a long day of travel (and having difficulty finding the hotel, thus dragging our luggage through the steets of Venice), and felt quite judged by the front desk staff. Although very nice, there was definitely an attitude of "what are you doing at this hotel?" which seemed to be lurking in their minds. The hotel is definitely nice, but not worth the money. We paid 320 Euro per night, which included a breakfast that was nothing to write home about. The room was nice and the bathroom, although lovely to look at, was certainly not the most functional friendly bathroom we had in Europe. The side of the tub is so high, my husband (who is almost 6 feet) asked if there was step stool in the room to use to step into and out of the shower. One small slip getting in or out would definitely cause some damage. The vanity was lovely, however, almost no room to actually put anything you might use, like toothbrush, toothpaste and razor. The overhead shower had NO water pressure and if I had just used that it would have taken 2 hours to wash the shampoo out of my thick hair. The little side shower is a pain because you spend all your time trying not spray in the wrong direction as there is only 1/2 a shower door and the smallest misjudgement ends up soaking everything you on the vanity. After paying the equivalent of $902 CDN to stay for 2 nights, it was a certainly a surprise to find out I paid for cappucino for breakfast instead of espresso and water from the mini bar. Really, for that rate, is a free water or coffee to much to expect. Anyway, if you're looking to pay too much money to stay in a nice hotel, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Warm, Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: bluewren703
Reviews.Content: After traveling for 24hrs and feeling extremely tired we were warmly greeted by Daniel who made us feel very welcome. The staff at breakfast each morning were lovely, always greeted us with "good morning" and a warm, cheery smile. All the staff we found to be friendly and helpful. We were very happy with our room, tastefully decorated, lovely view overlooking garden courtyard, side canal and rooftop views. Also housekeeping did an excellent job during our 8 night stay. The Palazzo Stern with its architecture, history, Murano glass lights, vases and Fortuny lamps and decor was a feast for the eyes and senses. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary while in Venice and we received a complimentary bottle of Prosecco from the staff which was a lovely surprise. We have very fond memories of our stay and would highly recommend Hotel Palazzo Stern

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a smaller boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: grossini
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, beautifully decorated, with a modern and spotless bathroom highlighted with great tiles. The staff provided excellent assistance with reservations and tickets. Breakfasts were a delight on the open terrace overlooking the Grand Canal, including delicious cappuccinos. Location on the Grand Canal in Dorsoduro couldn't be better. What more can I say about a perfect stay ? !

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular location!”
Reviews.Author: MadelineG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from the throngs and provides a welcome respite from fellow tourists, but is still within walking distance of everything. The staff is warm and accommodating, helping us find restaurants and sites off the beaten track. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Big surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dabbeljoe
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms, for our family with two teenage kids and we were surprised by the beauty and hospitality of the hotel. The room is very complete and looks great, with a beautiful bathroom with a bubble-bath, hairdryer, good lighting, windows that can be opened and very nice decorating. There is an elevator in the hotel but we liked taking the stairs because the hotel has a beautiful architecture. The breakfast is great: good food with everything you need like fresh juice, bread, buns, cakes, serials, hams and cheeses, sweet toppings, yoghurts, fresh fruit salad, bacon and scrambled eggs and a boiling bath to make cookes eggs to your liking. The beds are good too, the pillows are a bit thick. We didn't ask if they had thinner pillows but if you like thin pillows, you might think they are a bit too thick. We are used to hotels, also the more expensive ones and we had our share of city-hotels, but this is really a good one. The staff is also very friendly and speaks good english. We had several questions and each time they were very helpful. The reception is open 24/7 even thought it's a small hotel. A wonderful extra is the hot tub on the rooftop. If you book it a few hours in advance, they will heat it up and prepare it for you so you can use it privately. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there are several restaurants at walking distance and the hotel is next to the busboat-stop, so you can go anywhere you like. The walking distance to st. Marco is 20-25 minutes, the nearest restaurants are five minutes away. The hotel has a very nice terrasse where you can sit at the waterfront. The bar is opened untill 23.00 so order your bottle of wine in time and you can sit outside as long as you want! :-) There is also free wifi although the connection is not very fast and steady. All in all a very good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Venice is paradise”
Reviews.Author: Dab212
Reviews.Content: I returned for a second trip to Venice and was longing to stay in a very authentic if not grand environment. I chose the Palazzo Stern. A beautiful building right on the canal. It is in a perfect location right between the Rialto and Accademia areas. My only disappointment was the room. I booked on line - feeling confident that the website claim that every room has a view of either the grand canal, interior garden or side canal. All the photos also showed gorgeously tradtional Venetian decor. While my room was ok - it could have been anywhere. Windows did face the side canal, but were barely larger than an envelope slot in a door and furnishings were pretty contemporary and non venetian looking. I recommend the hotel - nice enough people, beautiful building but be sure you call to ensure you get a room as they advertise!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience of the year so far!”
Reviews.Author: joanne107
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived at the Palazzo Stern it felt like we had stumbled upon a traditional italian paradise,we had origanally booked a double room but the extremely friendly & polite manager upgraded us to a suite when he found out we were only there for one night,in his words he wanted us to experience the best of the hotel in our short stay and indeed we did.The suite was luxurious.By far the best seat we had was pre dinner drinks on the Terrace on the Grand canal the perfect place to watch the world go by. I was very reluctant to leave the next day & wish we had spent the full 3 days of our trip in that hotel.My only complaint if i was being forced to make one would be the pigeons on the terrace can be quite annoying when you are trying to eat but the hotel staff do their best to get rid of them for you.

Reviews.Title: “romantic, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: liz57615
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palazzo Stern is not an inexpensive option at over 300 USD/ night although we thought it to be a good value for the money compared to other luxury hotels in Venice. Perfect size at about 30 rooms makes it feel intimate & charming but still luxurious and with all the perks. Highlight is definitely the terrace on the grand canal. Excellent spot for morning breakfast or predinner drink. Standard room was still very elegant with upholstered damask walls, chandeliers, king sized bed, and lovely pearl-mosaic tiled, renovated bathroom with jacuzzi tub. Lovely, quiet location with quaint view over housetops and a bell tower out the back if you don't want to pay extra for the canal view (we didn't). Only complaint-- the rooftop jacuzzi would have been nice but was overpriced in our opinion. Still left with an excellent impression-- a fair price for an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: meblackwood
Reviews.Content: It is hard to say which is better about the Hotel Palazzo Stern - the location or the service. Both are outstanding. This was the first, but I hope not last, visit to Venice for my wife and myself. In all honesty she did the research and picked the hotel. She did very, very well. Until you walk the streets, alleys, bridges, and dead-ends it is hard to realize that location can matter so very much. Even hotels that seem near could have been a trek to reach. Not the Hotel Palazzo Stern. With a vaporetta stop next to the terrace on the Grand Canal the hotel was a breeze to get to day or night. I really felt for the people I would see hauling luggage up and down the streets and bridges of Venice. Breakfast was great. In fact, breakfast on the terrace or drinks there in the evening were two of the top treats of Venice for us. The American coffee tasted like Nescafe but the cappuccinos were divine and seemingly delivered by intuition every time I thought of one. Such intuition seems to be inherent in the staff. It was like everyone knew what you wanted or needed without being asked. Roberto had great suggestions for restaurants and was able to get last-minute reservations for us regardless of the popularity of the venue. (Actually, I think he could because everyone I met in the city knew him personally.) The only problem I had with the hotel was the wi-fi in our room was spotty and slow. I understand such is not the case throughout the hotel. It is a minor issue and I did report it so maybe if we are lucky enough to return and have the same room (502?) it will be corrected. We stayed in a small room overlooking a garden behind the hotel and an alley that is a small canal. It looked over rooftops as well and was a postcard in and of itself. The room was very comfortable and even though it was small we had a large, well-equipped bathroom. All in all a great place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: SherryBwood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at the Palazzo Stern. Our first trip to Italy and all of our research paid off. We got the smallest room, but it was lovely and comfortable. We were on the back and slept with both of the windows open for wonderful cool evenings on our very comfortable bed. The hotel is lovely with an incredible terrace on a beautiful section of the Grand Canal. We ate breakfast and had evening (and late night) drinks on the terrace. We enjoyed the campos (sp) behind the hotel. The staff was wonderful and Roberto was especially helpful. I highly recommend for anyone visiting Venice. I felt like our hotel was our own little part of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in Venice”
Reviews.Author: IM999
Reviews.Content: This was the second year in a row that I stayed at Palazzo Stern with friends. It was just as enjoyable as it was last year. My friends thought the hotel was beautiful and was an excellent value. I enjoyed being surrounded by beautiful Murano glass and Fortuny lamps and chandeliers. All the public spaces and rooms are decorated with elegant taste. The staff were all equally courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Deeds1177
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is all that you could ask for in Venice. The Vapparetto (sp?) stop is directly in front of the hotel making it most convenient. The building has been beautifully updated and meticulously maintained, the top floor foyer is a must see. The staff was helpful and attentive. Junior the bellman was especially helpful. Breakfast was very good and they allowed us to stay later than the posted morning cut off time of 10:30am. Two items to be aware of, or for the Stern staff to address. First there is no air conditioning before the month of May. One evening our room was especially hot and I asked for assistance in figuring out the a/c controls. I was informed that there is no a/c and i should open a window. The problem with that is that we paid a premium to face the grand canal and the noise is a substantial issue if the windows are open and one would like to sleep. For the price we paid air conditioning should be available 365 days a year, this was somewhat ridiculous . The staff offered a free water taxi ride to Murano and we took them up on their offer. It should be noted that this is a one way trip and you are on your own to get back. When we arrived at the island we were dropped off directly in front of one particular glass making establishment. The staff of this establishment grabbed my family by the hand and led them into their store where the tour and selling began before I even was off the boat. While I do not know for sure, I suspect that this entire process was prearranged and was honestly uncomfortable for our family. The internet, while free was frustrating to use. A long code is needed for every session.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TheWeedons
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a superb location - centrally located close to the Academia Bridge but in a quiet and private area away from the masses. It combines excellent levels of service with careful attention to detail. Nothing is too much trouble for the management, and their knowledge of the best local restaurants is invaluable. The rooms are beautifully appointed. Our room (a Junior Suite) was large and airy with large windows facing the Grand Canal. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was beautifully appointed with all the refinements one expects. The public rooms have been carefully restored to preserve the ambiance of the old palace and even the elevator has been hidden to prevent it intruding. The front of the Hotel has a large private patio and there can be few better places to eat breakfast on a sunny morning. The bar also opens out onto the patio. For us, it was the perfect place to stay in Venice. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Best terrace on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: italypro515
Reviews.Content: We are Italian specialists in the travel industry and have seen and stayed in many hotels. Palazzo Stern certainly ranks among our very favorites. From its well appointed rooms to its most helpful and gracious staff to its spacious terrace directly on the Grand Canal, we loved it for its peaceful setting in our favorite area of Venice, Dorsoduro. Roberto, Daniele, Ludovico and the whole stay made our stay perfect. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful breakfast terrace, no qualms at all”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Bristol_2
Reviews.Content: Just left the pallazo stern after 3 nights-no complaints at all. Dorsodura is a great part of venice, quiet with plenty of restaurants within a short walk, but plenty close enough to the rialto bridge, accademia crossing and on to st mark's square and the museums. The hotel is easy to get to off the water bus (right outside) and within an easy walk of the main sites. Similarly, easy for us to get to the train station to leave again. Breakfast reasonable, but sitting on the terrace overlooking the grand canal to eat it is hard to beat-magical. Would definitely consider this hotel again if/when we return to Venice, thankyou

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, brilliant service, great location ....”
Reviews.Author: KevinStuart
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the charm of a small palace with beautiful, intricate designs that reflect the history both of the city and the building. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal and offered a marvellous view of the flowing tide of various boats passing by. Cameras always seemed to be pointed at the hotel whilst we were looking out, giving us a glimpse of how it must feel to be a famous celebrity! The room was excellent, big enough to have two large comfortable chairs. The bathroom was worthy of a palace with hot and cold running jacuzzi within the huge bath. The only, vague cavil I have is that there wasn't a shower apart from a handheld device. The breakfasts were bountiful and were constantly replenished whilst the levels of service throughout the hotel were simply superb. This was our third trip to Venice and we decided that we will return. Will we return to this hotel? What do you think?

Reviews.Title: “The service sets it apart from the rest”
Reviews.Author: nigeldear
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing 5 days in Venice. What really made it special was the welcome we received at the hotel and the ongoing excellent service we received from the staff (courteous, attentive and efficient). The day we arrived it was very wet, windy and cold but when we walked into the hotel we were greeted with friendly smiles, helpful information on the hotel (including its most interesting history) and given recommendations as to places to see and restaurants to visit. Our room although not overlooking the Grand Canal was light and airy with an outlook over the gardens and courtyard at the back. The breakfast was an amazing array of both cold and cooked food which we thoroughly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the best we had since years”
Reviews.Author: Wolf123459
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel Stern is perfect, right in the middle between Rialto Bridge and Accademia Bridge. Behind the hotel are nice little restaurants and one of the best ice-makers of Venice. The room (Junior Suite with canal view) is expensive but worth the money. We enjoyed the breakfast on the terrace next to the Canale Grande in the sun with friendly service and a good buffet. My wife felt like Grace Kelly. The final of our perfect stay was the trip with the water-taxi to the airport free of charge. We will come back again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect romantic place !”
Reviews.Author: ElGoupilo
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, the staff is very friendly, great locations to walk, vaporetto station just in front of the hotel. A little too hot in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: scg411
Reviews.Content: We've been to Venice several times over the years, and this was by far our best hotel experience there. The hotel itself, in a restored palazzo, was a unique, intimate and interesting place to stay. It was fun to see the historic details that had been preserved. The lovely terrace on the Grand Canal was a perfect place to enjoy a leisurely coffee while watching the boat traffic. The rooms and bathroom were quite modern, clean and comfortable. Our room was quiet and pleasant, with windows opening onto a side canal and garden. The hotel's location was very convenient, just a short walk from the Accademia bridge. Finally, I can't say enough about the hotel staff. Everyone we encountered was extremely polite and helpful, spoke fluent English and went out of their way to assist us, helping us with restaurant suggestions, reservations and necessities of traveling with a toddler (milk, child seats, etc.) I enthusiastically endorse this hotel and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The building is beautiful, the location great, it felt welcoming, warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: wembley1924
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, made all the better by the attentive and friendly staff. We stayed in Feb 2011 in the week prior to Carnivale, so got a fantastic deal on the room. We booked a suite, overlooking The Grand Canal. We booked direct via the hotel website and requested that if it were available we'd love the room with a balcony. Well not only did we get this room but we were also pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of complimentary Prosecco chilling in an ice bucket with a little note welcoming us to the hotel. We arrived at the airport after dark and so splurged on a private water taxi to the hotel, which has it's own landing stage. As the hotel is at the bottom end of The Grand Canal this meant we got to go right down most of the length of the Grand Canal, an exciting introduction to our trip! The staff met us on the landing stage, they just seemed to know a taxi had arrived and we were checked in, the hotel doesn't have a long reception desk, but a big antique desk at the foot of the stairs, we were welcomed, given a seat, and promptly served a complimentary drink while we checked in! The staff who checked us in, gave us maps, info and showed us our room. But none of this was in anyway pretentious, stuffy or over bearing, it was just nice! Just a note, the Google map on the Trip Advisor page places the hotel in slightly the wrong area, it is in fact right on The Grand Canal not further in, as the map would suggest. Location: The hotel is near to the less touristy but still popular areas of Venice in the Dorsudoro. This means it's next to some fantastic local restaurants and the bars and pubs the locals use, including the university crowd. Having said that the hotel is pretty much next to the main art museum The Acadamia. Its about 15 mins to walk an easy route over the Grand Canal and to the heart of St Mark's Square. There is also a vaparetto stop right next to the hotel, meaning you can jump on a Number 1 service up or down the Grand Canal, which will get you to St Marks Square in 10 mins, or the Rialto in about the same time. Room: We were lucky enough to have a suite, which will be the best rooms in the hotel. The room was enormous, with 2 double french doors onto a balcony overlooking the action on The Grand Canal. Despite the room being large it was always toasty warm, and had full temperature controls. The room had 2 small double beds, extra pillows etc. There was ample large wardrobes, drawers and a safe. The bathroom was lovely (although the sink is a bit impractical in terms of putting stuff around it) and we think the room and bathroom had underfloor heating. Our room unfortunately had a broken whirlpool bath so we told the reception manager who apologised, they were unable to fix it so offered us a complimentary use of the rooftop private jacuzzi! Which is normally 70 euros an hour, Obviously we were staying in the hotel and Venice at a quiet time, which may have meant they were not bothered about clock watching, but we could have stayed in the jacuzzi for ages, well over the hour. The views from here are lovely, and on a bright, cold winter day being in the tub was a real treat! Breakfast is served by the bar, and in summer they must use the Grand Canal terrace, there were ample choices, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, boiled eggs, croissants, yoghurt, patisserie items, fruit, cold meats, cheese, etc etc. All in all this hotel was top notch, the building is beautiful, the location great, it felt welcoming, warm and friendly. If you can get a good price deal you won't beat this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: rskemp
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel after reading the amazing reviews on this site and it lived up to all of our expectations and more! We had a standard room on the first floor which was beautiful, unfortunately we didn't have a view of the Grand Canel but that didn't matter too much as we were on it most of the day! The bathroom was gorgeous with a splendid Villeroy and Boch jacuzzi bathtub (perfect after a long day of getting lost in the charming streets of Venice) and our entire room was cleaned twice daily when we were out - i only managed to bump into the cleaner once in our room as i'd left my autobus pass there, very swift and immaculate service. The bed was spacious and extremely comfortable and the room was kept at a good temperature (with the temp gauge on the wall just to let you know). The closets were perfect, a sensor light, easy to use safe, slippers, coffee machine (refilled daily) and a good selection in the mini bar. A lovely little touch is the daily weather update on the pillow accompanied by a chocolate sweet everynight. One higlight was the breakfast, all you would need was there, we helped ourselves to perfectly cooked bacon and egg most mornings and also a cheeky slice of chocolate cake which I imagine is there for the more adventurous breakfast eaters! We couldn't believe how close the hotel was to the 'Ca Rezzonico autobus stop and would urge anyone travelling to buy a pass for it during their stay (however ours didn't get checked once but I imagine in summer this would be very different). The service was amazing, could compare it to a 5 star hotel with the staff doing everything they could to make our trip more comfortable (even providing an adaptor plug as we'd brough the wrong one... Oops). We booked the hot tub for one night among the roof tops, it was gorgeous and a bottle of Prosecco and glasses were waiting with candles around the tub itself, the staff didn't mind that we took a tiny bit longer than booked and didn't interrupt until we made a call downstairs to say we were out (there was a telephone just in case anything was needed). Overall, it was a perfect hotel, perfect ambiance and an perfect place to get lost in! Thank you so much and will be recommending this hotel to friends and would love to come back some time in the future! :)

Reviews.Title: “Web site description is deceiving”
Reviews.Author: kiviko
Reviews.Content: The standard double room on the uppest floor made me claustrophobic with only a tiny window near the ceiling. The dustiness made my eyes red. The bathroom was beautiful, though. My request for another room was met with great consideration. The second room had a window in the ceiling which gave the room some daylight. The staff was ignorant of happenings such as the carneval and couldn't give much tips about where to dine and have a glass of wine in the neighbourghood. The breakfast was more like 3 than 4 star standards. The web site has totally false photos of the standard room even though the text states they don't deceive customers. Suites are probably nice since the location on Canal Grande is superb. But for a solo traveler who can't afford a suite the hotel is best to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “top quality, extraordinary view on Canale Grande”
Reviews.Author: christian_larzul
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this stupendous hotel to friends but it's worth spending a bit more money to book a junior suite with a view on the "Canale grande". Clealiness, service were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: CheshireCat_8
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough. We booked 2 junior suites for ourselves and our friends, both of which were huge, furnished with anitques, and had beautiful Grand Canal views. The bathrooms were spacious and luxurious, the beds comfortable, rooms not at all stuffy. They really had thought of everything and the staff were charming. Its a small hotel and has wonderful character - check out the mosaics and frescoes on the top floor landing. We didn't arrive until after midnight on our first day, but this was no problem for the staff who were waiting for us and got us settled in quickly. One of the receptionists recommended a nearby trattoria for dinner (another restaurant had cancelled a reservation we had made) and it was excellent (see my review on Ostaria ai Quattro Feri). Its a great base from which to explore Venice, being right on the Ca Rezzonico vaporetto stop and with one of the few traghetti on the doorstep. Its a 10 minute walk to the Accademia, and handy for everything else. I don't think you can do better in Venice, and certainly not for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Luxembourgers
Reviews.Content: Great location two steps from the vaporetto stop directly on the canal. Beautifully renovated old Venetian palazzo with old-world charm and modern amenities, and very helpful staff. We could not imagine staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: sestiere
Reviews.Content: After staying at Pensione Accademia in my last four trips to Venice, somehow reluctantly I wanted to try something different, knowing that Pensione Accademia was going to be hard to beat. I chose Palazzo Stern because of the location, the excellent reviews and the appeal of the building itself. I was not disappointed. The hotel is what I hoped for and more. The room was spacious, beautifully appointed and with a great view (a corner room with two windows) even though it was not facing the Grand Canal. Service was spotless, from the concierge to the chambermaid. The breakfast room, for the winter months, was cozy and cheerful. In the summertime you can have breakfast on the terrace by the Grand Canal and that must be grand (pun intended). Breakfast was typical for Venice: eggs, bacon (like almost everywhere in Europe, bacon was not correctly cooked for American standards, it was not crispy at all), cereals, cold cuts, cheeses, fruits, cookies and an assortment of pastries and delicious cakes. I do not eat bacon, so its crispiness wasn't a problem for me, but my only complaint was that although breakfast starts at 7:30 the eggs were not ready until around 8. A very minor point. The staff was very attentive; they made recommendations for restaurants that were right on and helped me with my internet connection. There is a computer for guests but there is also free wi-fi. That's a big plus. The building is a gem. It has been recently restored using old columns, marbles and reliefs. The mosaics resemble those of San Marco. A suggestion, add a couple of tabletop lamps on each floor to create a homier atmosphere and depend less on overhead light. Some corners, especially around the stairs, were a little bit dark. Overall, a fantastic hotel with a superb location and an outstanding staff. Grazie!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, comfortable, clean hotel with breakfast on the Grand Canal...perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ellenwoodoff
Reviews.Content: We will be staying here for a second time this September. I can not think of anywhere I would rather be. Exceptional hotel in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kas_f74
Reviews.Content: choose this place based on recommendations of other people on TA and was not let down. We took a junior suite (canal facing) and did not regret the extra money. Rooms are plush, comfy and clean.... staff are very helpful. Would stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance & Style.”
Reviews.Author: LondonPianoman
Reviews.Content: It seems that no expense has been spared in the restoration of this Palazzo.The location facing the Grand Canal is simply stunning & the traghetto (crossing the canal to San Marco) is just outside the door along with the vaporetto stop.Our room facing the canal was spacious & beautifully appointed.Only downside for us was the "hot" breakfast buffet style.If you are lucky enough to have the bacon & eggs as they arrive from the kitchen,then all well & good but if however they have been left in their covered serving dish for more than a few minutes,then the result is tepid food.Rest of breakfast choice however was very good & I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jjxxtt
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in late December. We had a triple room and a double room. The triple room was amazing and we were surprised when we entered as it had two levels! That room didn't have a coffee machine so Palazzo Stern graciously offered us free coffee and tea services during our stay (which we did take advantage of - tea came with yummy biscuits!). The bathroom had a standing shower with just a shower curtain surrounding it and it got very wet after each shower, but we were provided with plenty of towels so it was manageable. My parents' room looked over the Grand Canal and they were really pleased. Breakfast was good with mainly cold cuts, cereals and stewed fruits. The location was good, however it was closer to the Accademia Bridge rather than the more famous Rialto Bridge. This wasn't a problem though, as Venice is small and very walk-able. Water taxis, although expensive, are well worth it. There is a water bus stand right outside the hotel which was very handy. The gentlemen at reception were very approachable and accommodating, especially the gentleman who was at the desk from late afternoon to nighttime (sorry I didn't catch his name but he was so lovely). We had dinner at A Beccafico (quite close to the hotel) and it was so delicious. The mussel soup is a must-try. It was my parents' first trip to Venice and they thoroughly enjoyed it. Overall we had a lovely stay and would not hesitate to stay here again on our next trip to Venice. Thanks for making our family trip so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Friendsdrink88
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 nights and had a fantastic time. The hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful. The rooms & bathrooms were very nice, and the location on the grand canal right next to the vaporetto stop was perfect. The breakfast was also very good. Would come back and stay in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically romantic with old world charm, impeccable service, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: mamici
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was incredibly knowledgeable, helpful, and extremely attentive. They assisted with making reservations and recommendations for local (vs. tourist) restaurants and events (even on hard-to-book nights like New Year's Eve). Our room was a junior suite with a balcony that overlooked the Grand Canal. The "suite" was incredibly spacious with a large bathroom equipped with a tub big enough for a romantic soak. Location is in Dorsoduro, away from the main tourist areas but close enough to walk or even closer to the vaporetto station very near to to the hotel. Plenty of shops, restaurants, museums. We were thrilled that we chose to stay in Dorsoduro rather than San Marco. It is distinctly less touristy and offers so much intrigue, charm, and romance. Hotel also offers boat to travel to nearby islands of Murano and Burano. Staff happily suggests and handles reservations for this service. This was incredibly easy and added to our satisfaction of our hotel choice. We absolutely loved this hotel property and staff and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a beautifully romantic place to stay on the Grand Canal, away from the main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back :)”
Reviews.Author: BrianWenhold
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just steps away from the Vaporetto stop (Ca'Rezzonico) which was very convient. The staff was very helpful with recommendations around the city. Amazing blend of old and new inside. Felt like we were staying in our own private palace. Can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was ever too much trouble!”
Reviews.Author: zoltar21
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the information we received was excellent, advising us how to get around etc. Having a mobility problem was no bother to the staff they were always there to help, this made it so relaxed. The room was very spacious and the decoration was beautiful, there were blackout blinds and the room was very quiet. The breakfast was excellent with lots of choice. The ease of leaving the hotel and being directly by a water taxi stop made exploring more achievable especially with mobility problems. Also the shops and restaurants that are within walking distance were worth visiting too! We too had looked for reviews on trip adviser before booking our trip and we could not recommend this hotel and its staff highly enough. A special gift was left in the room for a special occasion that Dominec had discovered! This was a very personal touch. We look forward to seeing this beautifu city again and this hotel will be a must too! This is the first time we have written a review on a hotel but felt we had too!

Reviews.Title: “It's like being at home in a private palazzo with welcoming hosts.”
Reviews.Author: donclive
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern is a gem - a small elegant palazzo with a large terrace overlooking the Grand canal and near the Ca Rezzonico. The Ca Rezzonico vappareto stop is literally on its dorstep which makes the hotel very accessible when arriving with luggage - even wheel chair friendly. Situated in the Dorsodoro area with easy walks to the Giudecca and Zattere; and walking accss to Galleria Academia and other cultural venues in the area . Free wi-fi access. New access todigital TV but only Italian programmes ( as at Dec 1 2010) Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service to match a wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMallet
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, all of the staff were highly professional and made my wife and I feel so welcome! Our room was superb. Luxurious, quiet and very comfortable. Clean and beautifully decorated - with modern bathroom, flat screen cable tv and coffee making facilities. The large buffet breakfast- which we had served out on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal was very comprehensive and could not be faulted. Access to the hotel on fooyt was easy and the adjacent Vaporetto and Traghetto stops made getting around very simple. The location of the hotel meant we could easily access all the major sights during the day and then return to a quiet evening at the hotel, right on the main thoroughfare, but relatively peaceful away from the noisier nightlife places. If you can, do a water taxi from and to the airport! Such convenience and you get two extra tours through the city as bonuses. Restaurants, bars and cares around the hotel are very good local fare and make for good evenings out with only a short and safe walk back to the hotel. Overall, certainly not a cheap option, but - go on - for that special romantic trip - Spoil Yourselves! You will not regret it. This is certainly the best hotel we have stayed at in 4 trips to Venice over 12 years.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel , perfect people!”
Reviews.Author: NicosiaVenezia
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Stern is a lovely building and it is run by accomodating and friendly people. This was my second visit and I will continue to go back every year be it for business or pleasure. i only hope they fix the espresso machine in the room before I am back. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: sreedy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Stern last spring for our first trip to Venice. First of all, the hotel is stunning. You will find yourself taking a lot of photos of the halls, stairway, mozaics and the Byzantine altar on the 3rd floor which was right outside our room. Really beautiful. We spent time just looking around the old beautifully remodeled palace. Our room was a suite with a view of the canal. The little hall before our door had pinpoint lights on the dark blue ceiling that looked like stars in the night sky. Little touches like this are all over the hotel. Our room was huge, comfy bed, gold tiles in a marble bathroom with a large jetted tub. The soap, shampoo, etc were top rate. The bed was large and very comfortable. The linens were clean and very nice. We had 2 windows that looked out on the Grande Canal. There was a round table with 2 chairs between the windows. Lots of storage for luggage, clothes. Murano glass chandeleir and pieces decorationg this truly lovely room. Breakfast was really good. In nice weather, it is eaten out on the patio which is directly on the canal with no walkway in front. The breakfast room is lovely, also. It has mozaics and plenty of gold tiles like in St. Mark's. The front desk help was not overly friendly, but they are helpful. Ask them for suggestions for restaurants that are not tourist restaurants. We ate at a few of their suggestions and they were good. I think the hotel was getting a restaurant soon, but it wasn't available when we were there. I don't think the internet is free, except in suites, and Italian internet is frustrating everywhere. You get timed out and have to sign in with long passwords all the time. Still, at least you can get it here and they have a computer that you can use. I would stay here again for a splurge or romantic holiday. It is expensive, but worth it. Some hotels linger on in your memory for all time, and I thought this was one of those kind.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded High Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Palmosa
Reviews.Content: Our family met in Venice at the beginning of October to visit our daughter. We had two beautiful rooms; the Junior Suite with balcony and a room on a higher floor facing west with rooftop views and beautiful sunsets. Roberto, the manager, organized our dinner reservations and most important gluten-free food for my son's girlfriend who suffers from celiac disease. The gluten free cookies and crackers were ordered from a pharmacy and delivered to us upon arrival. It made all the difference in the world to her. The rooms and bathrooms were well appointed, spotless and the location was excellent. The real reason to stay at the Palazzo Stern is the accomplished, considerate and gracious staff. It was always a pleasure to ask Ludovico or Domenico a question about how to navigate Venice's streets. Irwin met each guest with a smile while taking late afternoon drinks or coffee orders. Many people believe that a hotel's success is based on location, location location. Whilst this is true, I would like to add special thanks to Roberto for his hotel's successful management. I look forward to our return next year to Venice and the Palazzo Stern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: freddinos
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel overlooking the Grand Canal. Everything about it was perfect!!! Would happily stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ctinari
Reviews.Content: My wife and two children, ages 10 and 7 and I stayed at Hotel Palazzo Stern in November after thorough research. TripAdvisor reviews did not disappoint. Palazzo Stern is an absolutely wonderful hotel. The staff was amazing. Ludivico, Manuel, Domenico and others made us feel at home and treated us like royalty. The breakfast consisted of eggs, bacon, yougurts, croissants and assorted danish (all very good). We stayed in the best room in Venice - Room 405 - which had a veranda (only veranda at the hotel) open to the Grand Canal, two queen beds, a modern bathroom and beautiful Venetian decor. The Dorsoduro neighborhood is fantastic. Mostly Italian locals walking the Calle especially during low season. The restaurants near Campo Barnaba and Campo Santa Margherita (a short walking distnace from the hotel) were very good and inexpensive for Venice. It is easy to take the Vaporetto (water bus) located just outside the hotel. We took a water taxi to the hotel from the airport because of the children. We paid 90 Euros each way. Venice was enchanting and inviting. My children were amazed by the way of Venetian life without automobiles and the history. Hotel Palazzo Stern was the best hotel I ever visited and I have traveled all over Europe. My family gives Hotel Palazzo Stern our highest recommendation. I commend Roberto Dazzo and his staff and look forward to a future stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “beutiful but....”
Reviews.Author: crispu3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, lovely staff, I helped with everything, very well located and our room was decorated very nice but very badly placed, very dark and very uncomfortable, there was no tea and coffee making facilities, as I said the website, so I'm very disappointed with the room, but everything else the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Palazzio in Venitia - Comfortable and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Necmergitur
Reviews.Content: A very good value for money... Simply excellent. Perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful address”
Reviews.Author: philetbene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo Stern for a week with our 9-yr-old daughter during the last week of October and we believe we made a wonderful choice. First, the hotel is perfectly located, with a great view over the Grand Canal (it was too cold to have breakfast on the terrace but it must be wonderful in spring and summer). It is close to everything and yet far from the crowds around Piazza San Marco. The hotel is right next to a vaporetto stop (but walking in Venice is so pleasant there is no real need for a vaporetto!), there are shops and restaurants not far. Our room was much larger than what we had expected, considering it was a standard triple room. It had very ample proportions and was very elegantly decorated. The hotel used to be a palace and the hall on our floor must have been a chapel one. It is decorated with beautiful mosaics. The breakfast buffet pleased the three of us. Service was very good. A special mention to the reception men, who were very helpful and made very good suggestions for our visits. Last but not least: a taxi boat can bring you at the foot of the hotel from the airport. It is expensive but very convenient and the ride is gorgeous. We chose this hotel after reading a couple of enthusiastic reviews on Travel Advisor. We hope our contribution will make you choose Palazzo Stern as well. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice for our first visit to venice”
Reviews.Author: efrnp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and couldn't have been happier. Great location for the vaporetto - just steps from the stop... we splurged on a junior suite with 2 large floor to ceiling windows that opened onto the Grand Canal. Just lovely... breakfast every morning was on the terrace on the Grand Canal. Can't wait to revisit.!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, beautiful building, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: historybuff73
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we fell in love with the picture on the website, though we did check reviews before we booked. The building was as lovely as we expected, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was very good. On a good water bus route for access to sites, but not too busy and noisy. The hotel was recently renovated, so in very good condition, but they hadn't destroyed its character.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,location and service”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsparis
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 9th -12th October for our wedding anniversary . Made very welcome on arrival, had a ground floor room with juliette balcony overlooking side canal. Location of hotel excellent, easy access to all main sites while being a 5 minute walk to local squares with good restaurants etc . The building is stunning inside and out , had breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal - very memerable. Overall a 5 star experience- if we go to Venice agin this would be our hotel of choice .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: davidandsally
Reviews.Content: Next to the vaporetto stop as well as a perfect situation for walking to main sights; very peaceful and with wonderful views over the Grand Canal. All staff extremely helpful and friendly. Extremely comfortable beds, beautiful bathroom, all ultra clean. It rained and was cold during our visit, but drinks and meals on the balcony overlooking the canal must be very romantic! Delicious breakfasts. All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: kennethgordon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in October. Our room was large and well appointed. The staff was friendly, helpful and spoke excellent english. The best part was the location. Right on the Grand Canal about 10 steps from the vaporetto stop. Yet it was well off the beaten path. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Vivaldi100
Reviews.Content: We looked forward to staying at this hotel as it had such good reviews. However, overall we were disappointed with our stay.
