Whilst the hotel is clean, and the building is very historic and in a great location, our experience as hotel guests fell short of expectations given the cost of our room. We were put in a room that was very hot and stuffy and from which the air conditioning did not appear to be working. When we enquired at reception, we were told that rooms did not have air conditioning (despite the hotel website advertising all rooms as having this) and that it was "only a heater". We were simply told to "open a window" if we were too hot (and with the room temp reading 25 degrees, we were!) - fair enough advice, but this of course resulted in mosquitos coming in. In addition to this, a generator situated at the top of our stairwell made loud noises at intervals all through the night. When we contacted reception about this we were told that they "didn't know what we were talking about", and nothing was done to rectify this. Overall, both of these factors led to 4 sleepless nights. Given the cost of the rooms in this hotel, we did not feel that that this represented good service or value for money. Even making a simple request of an extra pillow for our room took all day and 3 separate requests to reception, which gives an indication of the level of service. This was our first trip to Venice. It is an amazing place to visit, but our holiday was spoiled by the choice of hotel, and we would not choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An incomparable enchanting, romantic hotel, in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TFPetel
Reviews.Content: Our 6-night stay at Hotel Palazzo Stern has contributed greatly to an unforgettable week in Venice. Visiting Venice for the first time and planning for a whole week in this enchanting city, we did not want to take a chance and picked the Palazzo Stern based on the excellent Trip Advisor reviews; luckily we were able to book a room on quite a short notice. We can say that in every aspect the hotel has exceeded all our expectations: We were given a standard room on the second floor (no. 402). Although we did not have the Grand Canal view, we were satisfied with the calming view of the garden and small canal as well as roof-tops of the neighboring buildings. The room was beautifully decorated, clean and neat, fully equipped and comfortable. Service is efficient and polite, Reception staff most courteous and helpful, Breakfast is certainly fresh and satisfying. The hotel is located right next to a boat-stop (Ca' Rezzonico) making it convenient to carry luggage from and to the Central Station. In all, we loved our stay at the Palazzo Stern hotel and definitely recommend it to anyone seeking a quiet, romantic and pleasant vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: TravelJoe43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent hotel away from the craziness of S.Marco Square but still near the museums. If you arrive in Venice by train, take the #1 water bus and it will stop 30 feet from the hotel. How can you argue with that? The rooms are nice and the location and staff are great too. I will defintely stay here on my return trip to Venice. Book this hotel. We are glad we did. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyholiday95
Reviews.Content: Very good location in Venice. Good local areas nearby which are quieter and more enjoyable than the large famous piazzas. Excellent for transport-very close to water bus stop and also has a private place for water taxis to stop. Within walking distance of all the main tourist sites of Venice. Beautiful hotel. Stayed in a junior suite overlooking the canal for our honeymoon-champagne was waiting, and views of canal were very special. The terrace for breakfast is also fantastic-great views of canal whilst you eat.Staff were helpful and friendly. Only gripe is small-asked for an extra pillow but it didn't come, although we didn't ask again and room wasn't turned down after the first night which you might expect in such a special hotel. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, superb service.”
Reviews.Author: slopinot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days. The room was gorgeous as is the rest of the place. It is right on the vaporetta line. The staff was terrific, they took care of reservations and even researched what musical events were happening while we were there and then suggested a venue - which was great. I'd stay there again without another thought.

Reviews.Title: “the ideal hotel for relaxed visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Quentar_people
Reviews.Content: As we were leaving, we tried to sum up for ourselves why we'd like the hotel so much: the staff were relaxed, efficient, friendly and knowledgeable and clearly enjoyed their work. Our room was spacious, very comfortable and light (but note that it was one of theones had no views at all). The Hotel location is tremendous: right on the Grand canal, and right by the Ca' Rezzonico Vaporetto stop. (This makes getting and leaving with bags really easy: if you fly in, just take the public boat from the airport to San Angelo, and jump on a No. 1 Vaporetto going to St Mark's Get off at Ca Rezzonico and it's the first gateway on the left). The area behind the hotel has great bars, restaurants and shops but is not on a tourist beat. At least at end of September it was very quiet,.Yet you're just 5 minutes walk from the Academia and the Guggenheim. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal ... Internet access free and usable. Building itself, very old, and amazing

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, excellent service, wonderful desk staff”
Reviews.Author: nclewner
Reviews.Content: Hotel is directly on the grand canal; our triple room (with 10 year old graddaughter) faced the canal; very large buffet breakfast in on a terrace over the grand canal. The hotel is 14th century, with antigue structural elements-sculpture, columns, & a chapel with fresco,& floor and wall mosaics; & external antigue stone elements. the room was large, clean, & has an ancient stone fireplace. The reception staff was very helpful with restaurant , shopping & travel information. A wonderful experience !!!

Reviews.Title: “WunderschÃ¶ne Terrasse direkt am Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: MarieXY
Reviews.Content: Wir (Ã¤lteres Ehepaar) feiern jedes Jahr den Geburtstag meines Mannes (im September) in Venedig und haben schon einige Hotels kennen gelernt, aber dieses Ã¼bertraf alles. Die wunderschÃ¶ne Terrasse am Canal Grande (der Palazzo ist ein wenig zurÃ¼ckgebaut, daher ist dort Platz fÃ¼r eine Terrasse!), das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cken dort oder nachmittags einen Kaffee trinken (KÃ¤nnchen nur â‚¬ 3), abends einen Spritz zu sich nehmen - das ist Venedig pur. Direkt an einer Vaporetto-Station (Ca' Rezzonico), direkt am quirligen Platz San Barnaba (abends essen "nebenan" auf dem Campo Santa Margherita, drauÃŸen, mitten im Trubel), meraviglioso. Das Hotel wurde vor zwei Jahren renoviert; es ist sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtet und die Zimmer halt wie in einem Palazzo (Stofftapeten). Wir hatten eine Juniorsuite mit Blick zum Canal Grande. WunderschÃ¶n. Internet (mit Drucker) kostenfrei.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Curious-Monkey
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, my girlfriend and I were greeted by the friendly staff and offered a glass of fresh orange juice while they shared with us an overview of Venice and the sights to see. We stayed in room 501 and it was lovely. It doesn't face a canal but has a nice rooftop view -- including a nice church. The room was very elegant and the bathroom and shower were superb! The mattress was extremly comfortable. Venice is also incredibly quiet at night since there are no cars in the city. The hotel staff helped us arrange a private 2-hour glass blowing lesson with 2 masters / teachers on the Island of Murano. Apparently, teachers told us that we were the first to do this since the school opened 10 years ago! The hotel also has a rooftop jacuzzi that you can rent out during the evening... and offers a discounted bottle of prosecco to sweeten the deal. Highly recommended for a romantic evening. The breakfast buffet... and especially the waiting staff were exceptional. Breakfast is on the terrace outside right next to the Grand Canal. It doesn't get any better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venetian ambiance in great Grand Canal location”
Reviews.Author: Momsout
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location along Grand Canal at Ca' Rezzonico vaporetto stop, across from Palazzo Grassi. The Venetian glass chandeliers and decorative bathroom tiles, the friendly attentive service, private water taxi AND public transportation accessibility, the terrace right on the water for canal viewing, the excellent self service breakfast, the chapel on the third floor, the comfortable beds, the old world European touches with all the modern conveniences of air conditioning, jacuzzi tub, TV.....made for a VERY wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “My 50th Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: LondonTheWalkers
Reviews.Content: If you can afford this then go by water taxi from the airport 90 euro and a 20 min ride straight to the hotel. The location of the hotel is about half way down the canal, first class location. There is a beautiful outside area overlooking the canal where you can have breakfast and evening drinks. The rooms are first class, we had a suite overlooking a side canal. You must buy a two day pass for the water buses (very good value) everything in Venice is expensive and is you go the St Marks square expect to pay for two beers and a vodka and lemonade 50 euro!!!!! Gondola 80 euro for 40 mins, good value. The hotel had a jacuzzi which you had to pay 70 euro for one hour, although we used this service, we thought it was very expensive but beautiful view.

Reviews.Title: “Made the trip”
Reviews.Author: mzap444
Reviews.Content: After reading many tripadvisor reviews I chose the Palazzo Stern Hotel and am VERY glad I did. There are 3 bridges that cross the Grand Canal and the Stern is right next to one. Everything is in walking distance. My wife is 3 months pregnant and we walked everywhere. We did not take the vaporetto once. And if you want to there is a stop right outside the hotel. Other people complained about the noise, we had NO problem at all. When the windows are closed you can barely hear anything, but when you open them it feels like you are in a movie looking onto a glorious world that takes your breath away. I did spend more to have a room on the Grand Canal and very glad I did. The hotel was full but you would never know it. Breakfast on the patio is a HUGE plus and very enjoyable. I would never think about staying in another hotel in Venice other than the Palazzo Stern. And the bathroom is huge.

Reviews.Title: “I*ll be back !”
Reviews.Author: ANTE58
Reviews.Content: Breakfast could be better ! Parking place should be arrange through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This must be the very best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Corfton
Reviews.Content: We have visited Venice many times, and stayed in some very nice hotels, but the Palazzo Stern is certainly the most wonderful hotel we have been to in Venice. The position of the hotel on the Grand Canal is perfect, and surprisingly, it is very quiet at night. The staff are warm, friendly and couldn't have been more helpful. The Palazzo itself is lovely, with it's own terrace directly over the Grand Canal. Our bedroom was immaculate, beautifully furnished, with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal - and the beds were wonderfully comfortable, we have never slept so well! On sunny mornings to have the excellent breakfast on the terrace with the Canal just inches away was very special. We shall definitely be returning to the Palazzo Stern, and can't wait for our next visit; It is a superb hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Why would you want to stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Golfing-Steve
Reviews.Content: No stranger to Venice, having been regularly paying my compliments to the grand dame of the Adriatic for nearly 30 years now in accommodation ranging from tiny back street apartments to five star hotels, I have never stayed anywhere better than Palazzo Stern. It is a superb location in which to spend a holiday especially if, like us, you take a suite overlooking the Grand Canal. Nowehere in Venice comes cheap but the Stern offers serious five star luxury- the reason it is listed as a four star is because it only offers breakfast rather than lunch and dinner. The palace, once owned by an antique collector, has been lovingly and tastefully restored. It is light, spacious and with a beautiful balcony overlooking the Canal to take breakfast or an early evening drink. There are lots of good restaurants nearby, do try both Locanda Montin and Agli Alboretti where Ezra Pound and Peggy Guggenheim have respectively enjoyed their food, and delightful hotel staff to help you with any information you need to know about the city. Ideally situated for the water bus from the Ca' Rezzonico stop and with a traghetto ferry to carry you across the canal from the San Samuele stop, rowed by Venice's first woman gondolier, all the jewels of the lagoon are on your doorstep. Palazzo Stern is a splendidly luxurious base from which to see them all. To enjoy the very best that La Serenissima has to offer make your first stop the Palazzo Stern.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - made to feel very special”
Reviews.Author: london60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August and thought it was excellent in every way. We were made to feel very special. The location is stunning and the terrace must be one of the best places to sit and have a drink in Venice. The water stop right outside the hotel makes it very easy to get about. Location wise it is excellent and we found some very reasonable restaurants in the nearby sqaure. Breakfast was lovely and there was a wide selection of food. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and we will definately come back. Thank you for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little palace hotel in Venice, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Johanvn
Reviews.Content: Spending a long weekend in Venice for the last six years now, we discovered Palazzo Stern 2 years ago. It is a wonderfull small hotel, with excellent rooms, friendly staff and an amazing location in the best quarter of Venice, Dorsodurro. The sort of place you want to keep all to your self, as a hidden treasure, and only recommend because you think it is not fair if you didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly hotel in a quieter part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: bevandmark2
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here. We'd never been to Venice before and grabbed the opportunity for 24 hours of sightseeing before our tall ship (Star Clipper) cruise. We spent hours pouring over maps, reviews and of course, trip advisor, to try and understand Venice and figure out where we would like to stay for that one night - not too far from the sights but also within easy access of the port. We also didn't want to be in the middle of the mayhem, preferring a quieter option. We finally settled on the Palazzo Stern - it seemed to have all that we wanted - and we weren't disappointed. We took a water taxi from the airport - expensive but this must be the best way to see Venice for the first time and we felt that having already seen the view from the canal we didn't feel the need for an equally expensive gondola ride. The water taxi deposited us at the canalside entrance to the hotel and we were treated to a glass of juice in the bar whilst we waited to check in - there is only one check-in desk and another guest was being attended to. As soon as he was free we were checked in quickly and taken up in a small lift to our room which was on the top floor. As we were only staying the one night we hadn't bothered with the more expensive rooms overlooking the canal as we didn't intend to be in it very much and although the room was very nice it had no view at all - the windows were about 10 feet off the floor - the website mentions that standard rooms overlook the canal, internal garden or the rooftops - all we could see was the sky - it didn't bother us at all for the one night but if you were going to be staying for any length of time the lack of view might be an issue. The hotel has a nice terrace and we had a drink there before bed - and you can also have a very pleasant breakfast out there watching all the boats and activities on the Grand Canal. If you need to get to the port and would prefer to do it under your own steam then it is about a 15 minute walk even dragging a suitcase and is a simple route. Just to be clear however, the port I am talking about is the one that the ferries to Croatia go from and not the big cruise ship terminal which is a bit further away. Would we stay at this hotel again? Yes, absolutely, but would choose one of the more expensive rooms with a view over the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mane
Reviews.Content: Having extensively researched the hotels in Venice, we chose the Palazzo Stern. We booked the junior Grand Canal suite Room 405. PROS: SERVICE Prompt email communication prior to booking, and afterwards. It also appears to be one of the very few hotels that care for your opinion and respond to comments made by reviewers. On arrival we found the warmest welcome we have ever known from a hotel. Ludovico at the desk, is a star! He speaks good English, has an excellent sense of humour and a welcoming smile. He and the bell boy rushed to the greet us as our water taxi approached their porch. Led us by hand to the reception. Treated us like royalty. We were asked to to sit down with him at a table where check-in was done in a most elegant manner, and then he patiently answered our questions. Next, Ludovico personally escorted us to the room in a modern Otis elevator that was large enough to take six. He did not want to leave this task to a bell boy! Luggage followed later with the bellboy. And surprise surprise!... a bottle of cold Prosecco with 2 flute glasses and a welcome card awaited us in our room - what a great way to start a holiday. We popped the cork, filled our glasses and stepped out onto the balcony. Wow! What a view of the Grand canal. No noisy tourists anywhere despite being within 10 mins of most touristic activities! We stood there mesmerised listening to the water lapping at the banks whilst we sipped our drink. We spent hours just gazing at the boats move to and fro. We felt like celebrities as the tourists in their boats gazed at us enviously and took our pictures while we waved at them. The night time views over the canal (with its amazing water reflections) are to die for! ROOMS This is the largest room we have ever stayed in a hotel. It had very high ceilings, luxury venetian decor, & a giant chandlier (this place was once a palazzo and then carefully restored). There were 2 king sized beds, with 8 feet of free space at foot of bed! (despite our two suitcases perched on their racks). In addition, there were 2 pretty armchairs, coffee table, a giant dresser 8 feet long, bedside tables,and an extra table for your bits and pieces! A giant illuminated wardrobe with full length mirror stood against the wall. Most important for us were the luggage racks to support our 2 suitcases, a feature which is lacking in many hotels. In addition there were: -Large flat screen TV panel with Sat TV. -In room security safe. -Minibar (did not use it) - at check-out no ugly questions about mini bar usage either! Very polite indeed. -Coffee & tea maker with free coffee/ tea in room. -Air conditioning individually controllable, works perfectly, and is silent even with the 3 speed fan on. -Double glazed windows with totally noise free nights, despite being on the canal. No mosquitoes! And no foul odours from the canal (my son warned me Venice would stink in August). Looks like the city has sorted this problem finally. House keeping was immaculate and the hotel spotless. The bathroom was magnificisimo! Separate electronic heating controls to maintain bath temp constant. Hand shower, wall shower, biday, giant shaving mirror, hair dryer etc. Shampoo, soap, and half a dozen other little bottles! OTHER FEATURES: Free internet station on first floor with printer. Thank you! Large hotel terrace facing Grand Canal - great for breakfast and evening drinks. Full breakfast - bacon,scrambled eggs, boiled eggs (boiled to your required time), cold meats, toast, croissant, cereal, fruits, fruit juices, pastries, coffee etc. Breakfast can be had in the breakfast area, the terrace or in your room. Check out was efficient - took 5 minutes. LOCATION: The hotel is close enough to walk to all the attractions but also has these helpful additional features: -A private waterway access - water taxi takes you & your luggage right into hotel porch. No painful trekking with luggage through the streets and over bridges to find your hotel. -Vaporetto station next door. (get a vaporetto pass) -Traghetto station located in front of hotel, to cross over to the other side. -Gondola station is a mere 2 vaporetto stops away. -Three major museums nearby - Academia gallery, Ca rezzoniccio museum, and Peggy Guggenheim museum. -At least three good eating places within a 10 minute walk. Eating at St. Stefanos square restaurants is atmospheric. The walks in this area are quiet and peaceful and yet you are not far from anything. Thus, great rooms, great location, great views, no noise, a lovely terrace and full breakfast. What more can you ask for a perfect holiday? This hotel is thoroughly recommended. (The balcony suite is expensive but worth every penny...and you can get 20% off for a 4 day booking). CONS: The side of the bath is high and getting in may be difficult, if you have a knee or hip problem. A glass shelf is lacking above the sink in the bathroom to hold your personal toiletries. Should be easy to fix. Suggest you provide a rack in the lobby, to hold plenty of tourist information leaflets, for people to browse as in most hotels. This hotel is a hidden gem. Get the balcony suite if you can. You won't regret it! And thank you Ludovico for making our stay so thoroughly enjoyable. We shall certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in a beautiful area of...”
Reviews.Author: Jenni1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful area of Venice much less touristy than the other districts and in walking distance to all the sights as well as the local cafes The hotel is a lovely mix of traditional and contemporary decor and we stayed in a great room with a very pretty pink bathroom! Breakfast was very nice which you can eat on the terrace looking out on the canel The only thing that would improve the hotel would be more staff as service in the bar, at breakfast was sometimes slow

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cohenfamily
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It is in a restored palace on the Grand Canal next to Ca Rezonico. Each detail is exquisite. The breakfast area is overlooking the Grand Canal, and just this are would make the hotel a rare gem. The room was fantastic. We took the suite overlooking the Canal. It was roomy, clean, updated, perfect. The hotel interior was magnificent. As beautiful as any museum. The people were helpful. And the location is minutes from the Academy Bridge and right on a Vaparetto stop. We will definitely be going back and count our stay at Palazzo Stern as one of our most cherished memories.

Reviews.Title: “For a first time vistor to Venice....A Must”
Reviews.Author: Ida_Bea_Goinow
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at the Palazzo Stern. A worthy splurge for us and a wonderful room on the Grand Canal (Suite 404). Great view out or window. Spacious room and bath. Wonderful antiques through out the hotel. Best breakfast location in town with their wonderful terrace. We also had drinks there at night. Very convenient location near a vaporetto stop (the #1 only). We were able to walk everywhere and loved this city. Wonderful staff that was very attentive to our needs. . Loved being greeted at the door with a glass of juice after a long travel day. Dominec at the front desk was very helpful in recommending restaurants and mapping out a walking trip though Venice. Would love to return on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored Venetian Palazzo with Terrace overlooking the GrandCanal offering gracious personal hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Connellan
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers all the ingredients for a romantic Venetian getaway. Located on the Grand Canal right next to the vaporetta (water bus) stop and minutes from all the attractions. The hotel is small and intimate and everything was as described on their website (www.palazzostern.com). The value was excellent and the staff were very gracious. It was wonderful to be able to come back in the evening and relax on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal as well as enjoying breakfast there before setting out for the day. The one caveat I have is that the bathtub/shower is very high and an elderly person would have extreme difficulty climbing in. This pertains to certain rooms. Some do have a separate shower and bath so you would need to request that upon reserving if it were a problem. Bottom line, we throughly enjoyed our stay and hopefully shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service, in a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: tbirdMidWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been any better! The staff were extremely helpfual and friendly. We were supposed to be getting a train down to Pisa, and there was a 24 hour public transport strike - the receptionist Francesco spent ages on the phone, and arranged us a hire car instead. We were very grateful. The location was close enough to walk to all the attractions, San Marco, Rialto Bridge, etc. The terrace out front where we had breakfast was lovely, you could watch gondolas going past as you sat there. It was equally lovely to sit and have a drink there at night. the rooms were spotless, cleaned twice everyday, and we had chocolates left on our pillow every night, along with a little card with the weather forecast for the following day! It was our honeymoon, so they gave us a free bottle of sparkling wine, which was chilled and waiting for us in the room when we arrived. The breakfast was the best of all the 4 hotels we stayed at during our time in italy - bacon, eggs, toast, lots of fruit, yogurts, pastries etc, all delicious. All in all this hotel was absolutely perfect for us, it was very quiet too, with good air conditioning and good shutters on the windows. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Peace, calm, oasis,retreat.”
Reviews.Author: Irvinggetthecar
Reviews.Content: I have read nearly every review on Pl.Stern. I also did extensive research prior to coming to Venice. This property met all the expectations. The ease of communicating from back home was excellent, prior to arrival. The reviews were 99 percent on target and extremely helpful. Seeing that Roberto posted comments to the comments was impressive. Here are a few points that would elevate the property to the top ten in Venice. I was in suite 405. Just lovely. There are many comments about this suite on line. The suite needs a few modifications. The bathtub is an accident waiting to happen. This can be corrected with the installation of two small hand rails, and perhaps a small safety step . The counter top is too small to display your items. This can be fixed with the installation of one or two glass shelves. There are not ample towel racks, so there is no place to hook your clothes while in the shower. There is no robe, so when you have come back from 8 hours of touring for an afternoon shower, and you are not ready to get dressed again, and want to take a picture of the rainbow over St. Marco, you have nothing to put on. The front desk staff is cordial when addressed, but if you do not address them, you are barely acknowledged. It would be so helpful as other reviewers have posted, to have a welcome sheet that lists some of the special things going on in Venice at the moment, such as the exhibitions, the potential fireworks and such. The web site could also offer some additional information. For instance just a sentence or two here and there of information. For instance. If one described how very easy it is to prepay for the water taxi to the hotel, and that you get a 10E discount for prebooking a return or to your ship....Or that the neighborhood just near by has a little supermarket, many pay phones,an internet cafe etc. The free internet now offered here is a HUGE bonus. With my lap top and skype We were able to make many hours of calls back to the states at either no charge or 2 cents per minute. This is a fantastic property. I travel all over the world and report back to one of the larger luxury agencies in The States. They were not familiar with this property, but now they are. I basically told them to highly recommend the hotel, but to ask a few questions if they have an elderly couple with a hip condition. In which case they would be unable to stay in the best suite in the hotel, with the balcony. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Restoration Work”
Reviews.Author: catsinbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: PRO: Other reviewers said it all. #1 Restoration of the palazzo. Like no other hotels claiming their long histories. The 15th century Moorish -Islamic- palazzo bought by an art collector in the early 20th century is now restored by a new owner with (I am guessing here) a great artistic / creative vision. As a result, the palazzo is not just restored and renovated but transformed. #2 Attention to the details (both the hotel facility itself and the service) CON: very minor... a slow internet (but it's free) and no bathrobe #3 Relatively reasonable room rate for what you get. Very important. FINAL THOUGHTS: I would recommend this hotel to my friends with confidence

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricfromCardiff
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern is an excellent hotel in a great location. Right on the Grand Canal with a vaparetto stop a few metres away. A good breakfast is taken on the terrace. the service is very good. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jeep030
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location at a resonable cost. Everything was clean and brand new. Breakfast was great and you could sit out on the grand canal side patio to eat breakfast. The hotel was in a great location. Right next to the water bus stop and you could walk to everything. It would be helpful it the hotel could provide more infomation about the sites, tours to take and things to do around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Traveller186306
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Palazzo Stern for our celebratory weekend after reading lots of reviews and we were not disappointed in any way, in fact this hotel exceeded our expectations. The service was impeccable, all the staff we met were friendly and helpful offering advice on sightseeing and restaurants. Our room was not particularly large but was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, overlooking a garden at the back of the hotel it was very quiet. We were very impressed with the choice available at breakfast which taken on the lovely terrace watching life on the Grand Canal was a real treat every morning. The hotel is next to a vaporetto stop making travelling around very easy, particularly when arriving and leaving for the airport as you don't have to negotiate steps, bridges and crowds with a suitcase. This hotel is beautiful, but what made our stay special was the extra touches; from the turn down service and weather cards to the kindness of Roberto and his staff. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Delnole
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice. We wanted a nice hotel on the Grand Canal. The location is great - near a water stop. It has terrace on the water. The building and rooms were very nice and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: epatrickjr
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice. If we ever return Palazzo Stern is were we will again stay. 15 minute walk to St. Marks and Rialto Bridge and Market area. Waterbus outside the door, but, we walked everywhere. No need to take the bus when you are walking the the streets of one of the world's most beautiful cities. The staff was so welcoming when we arrived in our water taxi. Pulled right up to the door - literaly. Our room was a Junior Suite room 304. Three sets of windows that open onto the Grand Canal. Wow! For movie buffs, this converted Palazzo, was the site of the robbery in the movie "The Italian Job" Absolutely beautiful. Stone walls and stairs, chapel on the third floor (part of the old palace), stained galss windows. Just too beautiful. Everywhere we walked, everywhere we ate was just incredible. The hotel is located in a very quiet area with some of the most beautiful walks you'll ever take in your life, getting you to restaurants and sites. Great breakfast in the morning to get you going. In short, if you are visiting Venice stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid address”
Reviews.Author: PeterFerney
Reviews.Content: The building itself and its location are absolutely top. A palazzo, a real beauty (inside and outside), one of the beautiful facades at the Gran Canal, less than 1 minute from the waterbus Vaporetto. The service was very professional, helpful and polite. The breakfast does not exactly match the splendor of the hotel but was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: CoolMom5
Reviews.Content: Only royalty is treated this special!! You realize you made the right choice when the water taxi drops you off at the private landing of the hotel where you are met by hotel staff, after a georgeous ride down the Grand Canal. If that doesn't do for you, the warm welcome you receive when you are checking in and the beautiful surroundings should probably do the trick. It's as if one just stepped right into a fairy tale. The hotel is perfectly located between the Accademia bridge and the Rialto and right at the Ca' Rezzonico vaporetto stop. Which gives you tremendously easy access to everything, while at the same time, a short walk behind the hotel and you're in an actual neighborhood, with all the character of a real italian village. The rooms are huge (the standard room overlooking the Grand Canal is perfect with the views of a suite without the cost). You'll feel like a celebrity when the tourists on the vaporetto snap your picture when you look out windows. The rooms and baths are decorated just the way you'd want for a hotel in Venice, elegant and warm. Relax on the quiet front terrace enjoying a cool beverage after a long day of site seeing. You may just have it to yourself. Even though the hotel was completed booked during our stay we rarely saw other guest The staff is very friendly, helpful, and make you feel very much at home, which is what this beautiful hotel feels like. The turn down service, weather cards, remembering your preferences, etc., you just can't get this kind of attention and service in a larger hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Colorado03
Reviews.Content: We stayed three days. The room was nicely decorated and large overlooking the Canal. We've stayed at 5 star hotels and I'd rate this almost above them. We'd highly recommend It. Felt like we were staying in a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Among the very best in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Beaune
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel. The first night we stayed in Room 501, a standard room on the third floor in the back of the hotel. The room size was adequate and decorated tastefully with fabrics and a Murano chandelier. The bathroom seemed large relative to the size of the bedroom and had a wonderful stall shower. The bed was quite comfortable, as I do not even remember sleeping on it. The photos I included should describe the room better than mere words can. But we had hoped for a room on the water. Fortunately, Francesco, who was so professional and helpful during our entire stay, was able to move us to Room 405 for the next three nights, the room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. This could be the best "room with a view" in all of Venice. If you sit out on the balcony, you will be the envy of all the tourists that pack the passing vaporettos as they snap your picture. The Palazzo has been so impeccably renovated that everyone feels compelled to photograph it. The luxurious room and the expansive view are such a perfect combination that you might think twice about ever leaving the hotel to explore all that Venice has to offer. For what could be better than this? If you have never been to Venice, a word about location. For most first-timers, the question is whether to stay close by St. Mark's or not. My preference is to find a hotel away from this crowded area but one close enough to easily go there whenever I want. However, I should note that my wife and I go to Venice fairly regularly, so I must confess that the compulsion to stay near St. Mark's has long given way to a desire to stay where one can savor the real Venice. So that is why we have so enjoyed our more recent visits to the Ca Sagredo in Cannaregio and now to the Palazzo Stern on Dorsoduro. Now there is another aspect to location, and that is ease of finding the hotel and ease of access to it. Unless you hire a private water taxi and have booked into a hotel that is both directly on the water and has its own dock, you will find yourself lugging your bags to get to your hotel. Of the ten or so hotels we have stayed at in Venice, the Palazzo Stern is about the easiest to find and to access. Just take the vaporetto line 1 and get off at the Ca' Rezzonico stop. Walk along the canal a few steps and the hotel is right there. The three or so steps up from the sidewalk to the hotel are the only obstacle of any sort you will experience in your journey. And that is nothing compared to the bridges you need to cross finding the Bauer or the Europa and Regina near St. Mark's. You really do not need a water taxi from the airport to come to Palazzo Stern. Furthermore, once at the hotel, there is a traghetto and a vaporetto hard by the hotel, the former to take you directly across the Grand Canal (to visit, for example, the Palazzo Grassi) and the latter to take you either toward the Rialto or toward St. Mark's. Our room was magnificent. It was very large by Venice standards, with columns and lovely wall fabrics and an eye-catching Murano chandelier. The beds were very comfortable. The recent renovation allowed for an adequate number of electric outlets to recharge phones and camera batteries. The room was air conditioned with its own controls and worked perfectly. In Room 405 the shower was in the bathtub which had quite high sides and was a bit difficult for me to get into and out of when using. Breakfast time was the highlight of each day, and this is true whether you are in a standard room or a junior suite. That's because breakfast takes place on a spacious (compared to other hotels' tiny boardwalks on the Grand Canal, if they have even that) terrace where one can relax and enjoy the activity on the Grand Canal. To enjoy the terrace as we did in May under clear blue skies makes the high season rate for that time of year more than worthwhile. The routine for breakfast is to help oneself to the extensive choices of the buffet laid out just inside the hotel, which offers everything including eggs, and take one's plates outside to the terrace where the waiter will ask your preference for coffee or tea. Later in the day one can take drinks out on the terrace. The hotel is not of sufficient size to run a restaurant; so no lunch or dinner is served there. But one can always sit down and enjoy the sights. The terrace is, indeed, one very special place. There are few comparable experiences in all of Venice. In sum, the accommodations are luxurious, the staff from the managers to the waiters are cheerful, professional, and helpful, all the rooms are glistening, the location is excellent, the prices are relatively reasonable for Venice,....well perhaps five stars out of five are not enough!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: Dotti05
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice and our stay at Hotel Palazzo Stern was marvelous. This is a beautiful hotel. We received a warm welcome and were shown to our double room which had a view to a stunning garden. The beds were extremely comfortable and there was nightly turndown service as well as a change of towels. The tasteful restoration of the Palazzo provided us with beautiful surroundings--for example, a large murano chandelier was part of the room decorm. The breakfast buffet was delicious and well presented: breads, croissants, a large variety of cheeses, hams, salamis, fruits, yoghurt, cereals, capuccino. We enjoyed breakfast on the terrace facing the Grand Canal. Details such as free internet access as well as the vaporetto stop just outside the hotel added to our very comfortable stay. Staff members were polite, formal and very helpful in giving us directions as to how to find sights and restaurants. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BELLA Palazzo Stern -- Perfect.....”
Reviews.Author: moetw
Reviews.Content: I had the great pleasure of staying at The Palazzo Stern for 3 nights. As soon as I left the train station and boarded Vaporetto #1, I felt like I was in a dream....and the dream continued as I arrived at the (so easy to find) Palazzo Stern. Ludovico greeted me, Fawzi brought me fresh orange juice, and I was shown to my incredibly beautiful room. All I did was stare at the furnishings, the amazing bathroom, the out-of-a film view of The Grand Canal from my room, and try not to pick up all the spectacular Murano glass pieces in my room! The dream continued with a wonderful breakfast on the beautiful patio -- my cappucino, a copy of The International Herald Tribune and the sound of the water, vaporettos crusing by, and Venitian inhabitants heading off to work or visits with friends. I wanted to stay out of the too busy and noisy San Marco Square area. I did a lot of research and was thrilled with my choice and experience at The Palazzo Stern. The location is within a few minutes walk to The Peggy Guggenheim Museum, The Accademia, the wonderful environment of the University, and the real experience of a Venetian neighborhood. I did not want the dream to end.....enjoy and savor as soon as you can. P.S. And I loved my bed and its comfort!! Visitor/Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JamesBGillen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palazzo Stern is an excellent hotel in a great location - on the Grand Canal very close to, but far enough away from the crowds of tourists at San Marco. Everything about the hotel was great, including the free buffet breakfast. The rooms were very clean and modern. The exterior/interior of the hotel is very nice. Probably the only reason the Hotel Palazzo Stern is rated as a four-star hotel and not a five-star hotel is because it does not have a restaurant on the premises that serves lunch and dinner. The hotel is located right next to one of the water bus stops, so getting to St. Markâ€™s Square (San Marco) - or anywhere else in Venice, for the matter - is quick and easy. The hotel has a great, canal-side terrace where, if the weather is good, you can eat breakfast or enjoy a cocktail (the hotel has a small bar for their guests that is tended by the receptionist/concierge). All of the receptionists/concierges that we dealt with were very helpful. It is hard to find hotels that have three-person rooms at a relatively reasonable cost, as the Hotel Palazzo offers.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE - VERY SMALL ROOMS AND NO WINDOWS.”
Reviews.Author: Ednaleite
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Venice for the weekend and made a reservation for 3 nights in a double room at Palazzo Stern Hotel. The room first given to us was a very small room, with no windows, right next to elevator (in fact it felt like the elevator was inside the room). We asked if it was possible to change rooms because of the noise and they said that it was possible and that when we arrived from dinner it would be arranged. they just didn't say that it was located within the hotel's service area (between the kitchen and the street behind the hotel, right next to the back door). During the night we could listen to the staff talking and noises from the street, the floor of the room had 7 drain boxes from the hotel's sewage system and the pluming of the bathroom wasn't working properly. From what we could tell there were 2 rooms next to ours that seem similar to this one. We decided to complain to the concierge but got no answer until we made a written complaint and insisted on speaking with the manager. Finally, on our last night, we stayed on a room that had windows, was quiet and actually located within the hotel area.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Stern - The best kept secret in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Daviiid
Reviews.Content: Location: Absolutely perfect. If you want to feel the real Venice with authentic Venitians you absolutely have to avoid the San Marco area. Too crowdy. Dorsoduro in the area to stay and Palazzo Stern is in the middle of it, located right on the Grand Canal in a very calm street but very close to the vaporetto but also nice restaurants and bars. I can not see a better area for a journey in Venice. The Hotel itself: A fantastic real Venitian palazzo with a human size though. Beautiful, recently renovated with authentic old-fashioned but new venitian features. The service is professional, delicate and everybody seems nice and always willing to help... with a smile in addition. I had a Junior Suite with view on the Grand Canal (which I recommend). It was spacious (rare in Venice), calm, really lovely, with comfortable beds and the bathroom was the best I saw in Venice. Breakfast: simple but great. As it should be in that range of hotel (with good quality products). Conclusion: To be honest, Palazzo Stern is far much better than the Danieli, or the Bauer Palazzo and offer a much better location than the Ca'Sagredo. If you like luxury + bling-bling, then go to the Gritti Palace (a bit more expensive though) or maybe the Cipriani . If you prefer discretion but in the heart of Venice, Palazzo Stern or Palazzo Barbarigo are the place to stay in Venice. I have been more than happy with my journey there and I can not wait to come back at Palazzo Stern.

Reviews.Title: “incredible”
Reviews.Author: theperipatist
Reviews.Content: A small boutique hotel on the Grand Canal, Like a diminutive Islamic style retreat--beautifully restored---ornate arches,lovely mosaics,etc. We had a room overlooking the Grand Canal (they had very graciously upgraded us.) Again, lovely details (e.g. Murano chandaliers) Breakfast if weather permits can be taken on their terrace on the canal.The staff extremely kind and very helpful. For us, much cheaper--and far grander than the Danielis,Grittis,etc. And very close to the center--and a vaporetto stop next door.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Palazzo Stern is truly a gem...”
Reviews.Author: docneveu
Reviews.Content: After a cruise with the Ruby Princess from May 5th to 16, from Barcelona to Venice via several ports in Italy, Greece and Turkey, we spent five nights at the Stern before returning to MontrÃ©al QuÃ©bec. All the positive comments you can read on Trip Advisor about this charming place are true! Last December, after booking our cruise, we reserved a double standard room on the third floor, we were not disappointed. Every time we wrote by e-mail to the reception desk, we had an answer within the following hour. We arrived early on a Monday morning by water taxi from the Maritime station near Santa Lucia, we were immediately taken in charge. We had a nice full breakfast on the terrasse along the Grand canal. Our room of course was not ready, so we took a stroll to Campo Santo Stefano, had lunch next to the Fenice and at the very beginning of the afternoon were able to settlle in. Small, cosy room: double standard bed, closets on each side, mini fridge, huge modern bathroom with trendy shower unit, a safe box, slippers, murano fixture, two high windows, free internet, a beautiful view of Rio Malpaga and the garden in the back. It turned out to be not only comfortable but very quiet, sun in the afternoon until early evening and there is also an elevator. Turn down service in the evening with a candy on the pillow plus next day weather forecast. As other reviewers have mentionned, there are larger rooms in front with a view on the Grand canal. We never used the vaporetto all week. The weather each day was superb, we took long walks in different sestieres. We visited a few museums, the Correr, Academia, Guggenheim, churches, campos. (We had already spent one full day in Venice in May 2007). Do not miss the Squera di Trovaso nearby where gondolas are restored! We had opera tickets one evening for Don Giovanni at the Fenice, we easily walked back and forth. A nice choice of good restaurants all around and in the Campo Santo Stefano. Beautiful shops. The Palazzo is truly a gem and the terrasse where we had breakfast every morning, a good hearty breakfast , was fantastic, you can also sit there and day dream after your visits of the day or in the evening. In French, we would call this place an hotel de charme. A staff always ready to answer your needs and all your questions, speaking English and French. The quiet elegance of this Palazzo invites you to savor the "douceur de vivre" in Venice. I was a little scared to use the steps upon arriving by water taxi, feeling unsteady, Domenico helped me with an indulgent smile and made sure when we were to leave, again by water taxi, for the airport that I could embark safely and ask the driver to make sure I would disembark easily at Marco Polo. (Water taxi 95 euros for the airport, 60 euros for the train station, 80 euros from the Maritime station near Santa Lucia), vaporetto stop next to the Stern at Ca Rezzonico.) Venice is renowned to be expensive, but as far as we are concerned, our five nights stay at the Palazzo Stern was not more expensive than a standard room in Paris with the added value of being exquisite!!! And Dorsoduro is indeed very pleasant. And if you have tickets for an opera at La Fenice, the hotel is well located. A warm thank you to Domenico and colleagues.. Mrs Carol Patch Neveu, MontrÃ©al, QuÃ©bec.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - one of the finest in 19 trips to Venice”
Reviews.Author: kendall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have never gotten enough of Venice . Over 30 years we have managed to visit the city 19 times. We seldom stay at only one hotel; many times we have tried three different places on one trip! Such was the case this March, when I was curious to compare three new hotels that had recently opened on the Grand Canal. Since we are both in the design field, the architecture is very important to us, as well as the decor of the hotel. In my own words, "If the room isn't good, the trip isn't good". I had heard quite abit about the Stern from Trip Advisor, so I knew that it would be a good candidate. Making sure that we had a room on the canal, with a balcony seemed to be the right decision. We were not disappointed. Not only is the hotel a gem of architectural history, but the attention to detail and the superlative use of materials was amazing. The renovations were done with a great sensitivity to the original palazzo and its history. The materials used were first class- wonderful mosaics and Fortuny lighting. The location is great- do not be caring about the vaporetto station nearby, as the doors and windows are of such high quality that when closed, you will never hear a thing. Of course, we enjoy the sounds of Venice and always have a door ajar. The staff is professional, courteous, and very willing to please. When we needed a particular plug for a camera- they immediately went to the local hardware store and purchased one- and gave it to us when we left! The breakfast room is amazing- I think the nicest we have been to- the array of food was again, superlative- and the wait-staff always present , but very quiet. Our one request at any hotel is ice- I guess a more American necessity. We do appreciate a goodly amount, and again, the Stern was right on, with an immense bucket at any time. I believe of all the hotels we have visited, it was the intimacy and quiet elegance of the establishment that impressed us. The tariff was reasonable, and hopefully, shall remain so. We have stayed at many places that have quickly raised their rates for no apparent reason, except popularity. Well, in this town, there is always another competitor coming on the scene... (Farewell, Foscari!) We left the Stern far too soon, but had another adventure to encounter... we shall definitely return- even if I have to make our reservations a year in advance!

Reviews.Title: “A bit surreal”
Reviews.Author: PumpsieGreen
Reviews.Content: Having a room looking out on to the Grand Canal was quite surreal. As we watched the Traghetto go backwards and forwards and the vaporettos grumble to a stop from our window we felt we were somewhere so different from out car bound existence that it was quite otherwordly. The decor and furnishing of the hotel while very smart might have been a bit OTT anywhere else but in Venice it felt just right. We loved our jacuzzi bath and the beds were just right. The service was exemplary, breakfast very good (fresh OJ would be good though) and location amazing. The grand canal is quite a noisy high street and the vaporettos docking a few yards from the hotel do make some noise but we got used to it very quickly and the windows are double glazed. However the rooms at the back are probably quieter. Great restaurants are near by especially la Bitta and the locality feels a little bit less touristy than some spots while being so convenient for everywhere as the vaporetto stop is yards from the door. If you want a treat this Palazzo Stern is a good venue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: AmandaJaneUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Stern in a Junior Suite overlooking the Grand Canal. It was in a perfect location, with the sights of the Grand Canal, but away from all the noise of the centre. However it was so easy to get to the main sights - walking to St Marks Square in 20 minutes and quicker if you used the water bus. The staff were very attentive, but discreet, seeming to know what you needed before asking! We were lucky enough to sit out on the terrace for breakfast on our first morning which was great. We were in Venice to celebrate our anniversary, and there was a bottle of Prosecco in our room waiting for us on arrival. A very welcome and thoughtful gesture. It really is a special hotel - thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: JKE2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. It's located off the tourist beat but conveniently right on the Grand Canal at a No. 1 Vaporetto stop and nearby a square with shops, restaurants, etc. We stayed in a room with a view of the Grand Canal--a parade of boats we never tired of seeing each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay - if the Air conditioning is in season!”
Reviews.Author: jayozee
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner here at the end of April and on the whole the Palazzo Stern is nice place to stay but it did come with its inconviencies as most places do. The biggest one was that the air conditioning is seasonal so it is only available in the summer. Two of our days were really hot and our room was on the 3rd floor. Our room was so hot it was uncomfortable and there was nothing they could do about it so we just had to suffer it as the hotel didn't have any fans - i just think that if you are paying 4 start prices then you should be able to control the air con all year round. I'm not sure if its the same in most hotels in Venice or just this one. Although my falut for not reading up - the hotel dosn't not have a restaurant! I just assumed it would! It meant we had to find restarants every night and some of them wern't that good even though they were recommened on the hotels map. Another thing that irritated me (altough very minor :) I asked for Tomato ketchup at breakfast for my bacon sandwich and was told by the waiter "We don't have any, other guests have asked for it in the past, but we dont have it". If people have asked for it in the past why didn't he take it upon himself to get some? On the plus side breakfast in the sun on the canal terrace was wonderful. Comfortable beds and nice bathrooms, helpful staff, spotlessly clean, Close Varapetto stop. I wouldn't stay here again only because I would want to stay somewhere with a restaurant but if you dont care about that and the air con is in season then stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: lipi5star
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the good reviews and I was not disappointed at all. Like the other customers I believe this hotel should remain a well kept secretâ€¦because the rate between quality and value is amazing. Hotel is quite new so this means: nice bathrooms, good beds, flat screen TVs. Really a dreamy little palazzo youâ€™d like to own! Very nice staff, even if in reduced (savvy) number. There are a few facts people need to know: There is no restaurant in the hotel and no room service. This means that when you arrive in the evening and might be tired from your trip or it might be raining, you HAVE to go out of the hotel and search for a restaurant (not easy upon fresh arrival). For what concerns me, I never eat well in Italy, except when I pay a very high price in high end places (100EU per person). The breakfast at the hotel though is very nice compared to usual Italian standards, good choice of everything. Be also aware that the Vaporetto stop is in front of the hotel and some Vaporettos are really in a nearly sinking condition, with horribly noisy motors. So if you hate noise I advise you to ask for a room that doesnâ€™t have a view on the Grand Canal. I had a side room and was very happy with it, even though I still could hear the boats. Except that, would definitely go back, the sooner, the betterâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate Grand Canal experience”
Reviews.Author: mgcoleman
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Stern delivered on all counts on our recent visit. Palatial rooms (we had canal-facing junior suites #304 and 306) with great bathrooms. Super breakfast buffet. Sadly too cold to avail ourselves of the lobby terrace or the rooftop jacuzzi, but these are mere quibbles next to the beauty, cleanliness and overall moo-wah of this place, which was a private residence for years and only opened as a hotel in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “The Essence of Venice”
Reviews.Author: IXMartin
Reviews.Content: I was a guest in a Palazzo from the past, only with all the modern conveniences. The furnishings were grand and elegant; there was no fresco on the ceiling in my room, but there was a beautiful Murano chandalier instead. My room looked over the beautiful red tiled rooftops and into a garden next door, and my friends had a view of the Grand Canal. The location could not have been more convenient; at the front door was a vaporetto stop, and if you choose to arrive by taxi, there is a gate by the side canal straight to the front porch of the hotel. My friends and I found the neighborhood of San Barnaba chamring and friendly with fewer tourists than the other side of the Grand Canal. We called it our neighborhood and went to all the neighborhood restaurants, which were excellent. I will definitely stay at the Palazzo Stern again and recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “For us this is the Number One hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Angela052
Reviews.Content: This delightful hotel has joined those extra special places we love to remember after 40 years of travelling. It is beautifully restored - our enormous luxurious room had huge windows overlooking the Grand Canal and wonderfully comfortable chairs and beds. We could have spent the whole three days just looking out of the window! We thought the breakfasts were excellent particularly the perfect scrambled eggs and bacon. Most of all, though, every member of staff made us feel welcome and cared for. Our warm and helpful welcome from Ludovico set the tone and we soon realised Roberto has a happy staff confident that their guests will enjoy their stay. We were lucky after the snow of the previous week to have three gorgeous days of blue sky and sun in magical Venice but even luckier to have discovered 'our' room to, hopefully, return to again and again! Having never posted a review before I was a little loathe to increase the likelihood of not being able to get a reservation in the future but that would be so unfair so here it is!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, good Service, fast fine,”
Reviews.Author: twoH
Reviews.Content: we stayed three days, paying for two, excellent idea in lower season, that makes life easier

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Perfect location for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: pragmatopian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a birthday treat. The staff were very friendly and helpful, highlighting places we could visit and travel options. The room was clean and well-appointed. The veranda, overlooking the Grand Canal, was the perfect place to enjoy breakfast. The hotel was in a quiet location but within easy reach of the main turist attractions. It was more than we would normally pay for a hotel room, but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the luxurious surroundings made our trip to Venice all the more special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: HongKongTrueBrit
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in Vencide including the last 2 days of the 2010 carnival. We had booked a classic superior room, and were given #305 which has windows opening onto the Grand Canal. Upon arrival, the receptionist was friendly and welcoming and spent time explaining hotel facilities as well as travel options. The room is beautifully decorated and very comfortable. While the breakfast may not be the most varied, it is of high quality and beautifully presented. The verandah overlooking the Grand Canal is ideal for evening drinks. An added bonus is the location right by the Ca' Rezzonica Vaparetto stop and the traghetto across to the other side of the Grand Canal. Staff are very helpful and courteous. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Latvia_SE
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern is a luxurious small hotel that looks and is decorated like a palace and is absolutely perfect in every way! It has great location on the Grand Canal (very quiet but close to everything), there is both a vaporetto and a traghetto stop outside the hotel (Ca 'Rezzonico) and it is just a 5 minute walk away from the Accademia bridge that leads to San Marco. The building is carefully renovated, very elegant, the rooms were spotless, the staff was wonderful, the service was impecable and the breakfast was very good. We enjoyed every minute of our stay there! The only thing we missed was warmer weather so that we could sit on the terrace outside and enjoy the magnificent view of the Grand Canal with a nice glass of Italian wine!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LC_irish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and we would definately stay here again. The location is perfect for anyone wanting to explore the city. We entered the hotel from our taxi boat and were greeted at the door, where are bags were taken from us. Our check in was quick and we were guided to our room and shown around, which made us feel very welcomed. The front desk staff were very help and polite and were super with directions. The room was very clean and was cleaned with fresh towels twice a day. The bathroom was beautiful, very modern and bright. It too was very spotless. A weather forecast card and sweets were left on our pillows in the evening, which was a lovely touch. We enjoyed our buffet breakfast, where a selection of breads, pasteries, eggs etc were on display. The restaurant staff were so polite and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance from all the main tourist attractions and it is situated on a water bus stop. However there is no direct route from this to the airport. Our one complaint was that the man on the front desk told us to change stops at s.angelo and get onto the water bus route 2 for airport connections but after waiting at this stop for over forty minutes we had to get a water taxi to the airport and it left in a bit of a rush. I would recommend if you do not want to get a water taxi to the airport (which cost us 95euro), that you get the water bus from the Rialto which is not too long a walk from the hotel. Venice did experience some flooding while we were there but the hotel provided us with umbrellas and there was no fear of the hotel flooding. We did purchase wellies just around the corner from the hotel too. Our stay in Hotel Palazzo Stern was a very enjoyable one and we do hope to return again and make use of the eating area on the water front and the jacuzzi (weather permitting).

Reviews.Title: “A marvellous, friendly and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: GNCParis
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, very friendly staff, beautiful rooms and bathrooms, superb setting. We enjoyed ourselves immensely and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “classic Venetian luxury”
Reviews.Author: Halfapound
Reviews.Content: Based right next to the Ca Rezzonica vaporetto stop, the stay at the hotel starts well as there's no lugging bags round the narrow streets. You enter via a beautiful terrace, the only hotel with one on the Grand Canal (I believe). On checkling in, we were given a map and guide to some of the famous spots/churches etc and how to get there, which was very helpful. Cases were then taken up to the room, which was absoultely beautiful with a great en suite complete with whirlpool bath (a great way to relax after long days walking round Venice). Nice touch was two maid services per day, so our room was back to new when we got back from a day out and after our evening meal, complete with card on the pillow giving weather forecast for next day, which was very handy. Also had temperature control. Breakfasts were very tasty and catered for all tastes, so us Brits could have bacon and eggs as well as Continental style (although bacon was actually grilled parma ham, which actually was v nice). As a former palace, the decor was stunning everywhere - in the breakfast room, the communal areas and the room itself. We got a greaty deal because of the time of year, so were only paying just over Â£100 per night, great value if you can get something similar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Palazzo in a perfect surrounding”
Reviews.Author: Stefan000
Reviews.Content: Friendly personnel, nice breakfast, close to the center. Rooms are very beautiful! Internet speed could be much beter.

Reviews.Title: “WE Know Hotels an other locations in Venice since over 10 years the Palazzo Stern is definitly a place to be !”
Reviews.Author: FredMunich
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Stern is located directly at CaÂ´Rezzonico, that means you have direct access from the boat ( linea 1 ) from Piazzale Roma or anywhere else. The rooms are really large ( for Venice ) and the bathrooms also ( for Venice ). Very clean and quiet. Excellent staff. Very good value for price. Room service twice a day . Jacuzzi on the roof. Small and cosy location.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: danasta
Reviews.Content: Everything was just right! The staff were fantastic, the rooms were comfortable, the breakfast good, and the hotel beautiful. One of the best hotel stays we've had!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying Venice”
Reviews.Author: RODDYTOULOUSE
Reviews.Content: When you decided to spent 3/4 days in Venice, you do need to be in the best possible accomodation because need to be close from sites/museum/...., need to rest in the best condition because you walk a lot in Venice,need to be well supported by hotel personal because of information needed and a warm welcome is fantastic to feel like at home. Thanks to Palazzo Stern which offer all that.

Reviews.Title: “best adress on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: lovesmallhotels
Reviews.Content: palazzo stern is a beautiful little hotel in the best part of grand canal close to Accademia bridge. rooms are tastefully decorated and most of them with a nice view. the room we stayed in had a great view over the rooftops. bathrooms are very large and nicely done. nice breakfast, the best brioche in town. friendly and helpful staff. looking forward to staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “serenity in la serenissima”
Reviews.Author: spv
Reviews.Content: imagine a place where you not only wished you never had to leave, but felt at home. that describes our stay at the palazzo stern. from the courtesy and warmth of the staff to the convenience of its location, i could not imagine a finer stay in venice. after 5 days, the room, the sestiere of dorsoduro, our personal traghetto and vaporetto station, the museums and churches all felt like 'ours.' the nearby piazzetto of san barbaro boasted a fabulous gelateria and the osteria oniga; around the corner, by the ponte dei pugni, a duo of cozy bars, one chic, one homey--great for a cocktail, prosecco, or a spritz. nearby, the campo santa margherita was a lively nightspot, and anything we missed "titi," ludovico, or domenico would find for us.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful restored palace hotel, great location on grand canal, friendly service and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LondonJazzman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Venice for the first time for our siiver wedding anniversary and had been recommended this hotel by close friends. It surpassed our expectations on all fronts - standard of facilities, staff service, wonderful location on the Dosoduro side of grand canal next to Ca' Rezonnico stop on No 1 actv line. The hotel itself is a beautifully restored palazzo. Particularly welcome was the excellent breakfast to set you up for each day. Also some excellent reasonable restaurants close by. It also proved very accessible for arrival and departure - we took the Alilaguna blue line from Marco Plo airport to Zattere and happily trundled our luggage from there to the hotel. Equally, on departure it was easy to trundle our luggage to Piazzale Roma for the bus back to the airport. We shall return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Numero Uno in Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: CarysWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location and has great accommodation. I can highly recommend it. If you arrive on the Alilaguna waterbus from Maro Polo airport (13 e) this takes you into San Marco (Vallaresso) - as you come off the pontoon take a left and walk up to the vaporetto station a few metres away - you can either purchase a one-stop ticket for 6.50 euros or a travelcard which would cover you for 12/24/36 hours, etc (36hrs cost me 23e which was well worth it). Just make sure you validate the ticket before your first journey as there are inspectors that check your ticket and this can incur a 44e fine. You need the No. 1 vaporetto to Ca'Rezzonico - in the direction of Piazzale d. Roma. This journey then takes no more than 10 mins to the hotel. The hotel is just on the left as you come out of the vaporetto stn. Perfect! I was warmly greeted on arrival and the receptionist spoke good English - the hotel has 3 floors - my room was small and tastefully furnished with a fantastic Villeroy & Boch bathroom, free coffee machine, minibar, plasma screen (CNN/BBC in English) - the room was on the side canal (3rd floor) and quite quiet however if you are going to splurge out and pay a premium for a room on the Grand Canal then you can expect a bit of traffic noise - the Grand Canal is a very is busy 'street'! The hotel doesn't have a restaurant for dinner or lunch but breakfast was very acceptable with juice/ham/cheese/scrambled eggs/crispy bacon/croissants/yoghurt and a choice of Twinings tea. I had breakfast on my three mornings there out on the terrace -beautifully sunny but cold and wonderful to watch all the Grand Canal traffic going by! The Palazzo Stern is in a far better location than some of the other more expensive 5 star accommodations down at the bottom end of the Grand Canal like the Danieli/Metropole which do not have ground floor terraces actually overlooking the canal, as they open directly out onto the long promenade. Define attractions to visit are of course the Basilica in San Marco, Palazzo Ducale (next door to Basilica) - 12 euros, Rialto Bridge and the markets (mornings), do a circumnavigation of the Grand Canal on the No. 1 vaporetto and change to the No. 2 at Pizzale d. Roma and go towards San Marco - you can get off at San Basilio/Zattere (Duorsoduro) and walk along the long promenade for afternoon sunshine and then go on to San Giorgio to see the church where you can take a trip for 3 euros to the top of the belfrey and get a great view over to San Marco (cheaper than going to the top of the Campanile!). Eating is a minefield - just go with your sixth sense and hopefully you won't be disappointed! Venice is very safe so relax and enjoy - speak a few words of Italian and you will soon be enjoying La Dolce Vita (or is that Rome?!). I will, without hesitation, definitely be back to the Palazzo Stern!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: RapunzelRapunzel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite simply a knockout. I couldn't think of a thing that could have made our stay better. Honestly, if you're looking for a classy, smaller hotel that's luxurious without being ostentatious and reflects the real spirit of Venice, don't hesitate to book this one. It's a delight in every respect. In summary: Wonderful building, fabulous restoration, elegant decor, peaceful atmosphere, beautiful room, lovely service, perfect location, stunning views, superb overall experience. And as for the terrace on the Grand Canal - absolutely priceless..... Thanks, Palazzo Stern, for living up to your reputation 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, but poor services”
Reviews.Author: FeronoFer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really good, but there are room service and itÂ´s a problem nowday, because we need to leave from hotel to eat something

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: VenicefanGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. It would have to be the best hotel I have stayed in. The room was excellent the decor was excellent. Having breakfast each morning overlooking the Grand canal was the highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you want somewhere special in Venice-indulge yourself”
Reviews.Author: Furney585
Reviews.Content: It was our 30th Wedding Anniversary and the hotel proved to be that little bit special. Stunning architecture. Luxurious room overlooking the Grand Canal, definitely worth the extra cost. Such a delight to sit on their terrace and be close to all the watery action. Easy to reach all the attractions with a Vaporetti stop on the doorstep. Staff were helpful, even when we arrived late at night. All requests were answered graciously. An error on our bar bill was settled amicably after further enquiry.A welcoming congratulatory drink would have gone down well but this was a minor negative. I had mentioned the occasion to them in advance, even writing in Italian at one point. I did receive a very kind response by reply. We can reccommend a Trattoria 'La Bitta' very close to the Hotel and 'A La Bricola', near San Marco, for eating, if it is excellent local food, in lively , friendly atmospheres you want. Both very welcoming. For the next special occasion in Venice, we would not hesitate to go to Pslazzo Stern

Reviews.Title: “Amore Love the Stern”
Reviews.Author: ms.go-go
Reviews.Content: This could not have been any more perfect for my husband and I to spend our 25 th wedding anniversary . I had searched over and over all the details of the many hotels in Venice. This was my choice and it was better ....way better then I imagined. It was charming, beautiful and most of all romantic. Its location on the canal adds to the charm and romance. We were able to enjoy the canal view from our room that was located in the front of the hotel. We looked out at the canal and saw Venice rolling by. People were rolling by and taking photos of the hotel. It is beautiful on the inside as well as on the outside. Beautiful to look at both day and lite up at night. It did make you feel lucky to have such a special spot to relax and enjoy that others were drawn to the beauty made me appreciate how special my anniversary really was. The room was so elegant. It was elegant and comfortable. Both the room and the bath were large. The bathroom had a shower and a tub and it was done in such a wonderful glowing tile. The golds and rich colors of the hotel made it feel like a grand palace. It is a small and intimate hotel where I could honestly say it was very peaceful there. The neighboorhood isquiet and charming. It is in the Dorsoduro section. Eating breakfast out on the patio was so enjoyable and late in the evening we had nightcaps out there. We meet charming couples there.. the couple from Scotland....from Dubai, the woman traveling alone from New Zealand....the hotel was small enough to enjoy other travellers, not mobs of guests. The location is right on a water bus stop Ca' Rezzonico and there is a vapporetto stop as well. And when I say right on I mean right there. We decided to take the private water taxi to the hotel from the airport since we had a long trip to get there. Close to 19 hours..and this was the best choice as it was fast ( direct to hotel), not crowded...( buses are packed), just my husband and I, (romantic .! ) Seeing the sights of Venice for the first time is spectacular and some of the best pictures I took were on this ride. It was worth the money. The boat was beautiful. And once I got into my room I really felt like the Princess! But it is nice to have the water bus right there and after arriving the staff helped us get tickets and help us with directions to use the system. The staff was helpful and kind. Not just the front desk but the Phillipine porter (what a great smile and personality) and the waitress at breakfast ( same for her). I felt as if I stayed in a Palace for a few days. Felt like it was my honeymoon all over again ( pretty good after 25 years) What more can I say. Don't miss this hotel if you are looking for a first class hotel for a romantic getaway to one of the most romantic cities in the World.

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly, Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb0rahB
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and it was wonderful.
