The location is ideal - near to all the major sites but away from the bustle and crowds at the end of the day. The palazzo interior was elegant and stylish. All members of staff were very helpful and always courteous. Breakfast was excellent and it was great that it was served until 10.30, so you could have a lazy start to the day if you wanted to. Also nice to have an outside terrace looking over the Grand Canal - even in October, we managed breakfast outdoors a couple of times. Air conditioning in the room was a little chilly, for an October afternoon, if you wanted to come back for a rest before the evening - we couldn't figure out how to turn the temperature up! Would definitely recommend the hotel, although, like everything in Venice, you need a generous budget to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “a jewel mini size palazzo with a terrace onto the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: GALABOUTTOWN
Reviews.Content: A truly charming hotel - staff incredibly helpful - travelling with a two year old has to be one of life's great challenges for a family - despite the hotel's grace and formal interior, we were made to feel entirely at home. One minor snag is feeding that 2 year old - they hotel does not have in house meals apart from breakfast - and venice restaurants do not open till 7pm - making early dinner tricky - otherwise, we could not fault the hotel - all our requests and questions were answered speedily - our room was stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking restoration of a gem of a palazzo, with spacious comfort and wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: holly1257
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the junior suite with the balcony overlooking the grand canal. Our room was beautifully decorated, with no comfort overlooked. The bathroom with it's "bubbly tub" and shower was a modern marvel, while the rest of the room had a definite, luxurious "old world" feel, with wood floors, persian carpets and beautiful fabrics. The palazzo is beautifully restored, with gleaming woodwork, vaulted ceilings and beams, original stained glass and mosaic tile floors. It is just exquisite! The service was perfect; unobtrusive but very helpful. Whenever we left the room it would be made up perfectly when we came back. The beds were very comfortable, with luxurious linens and coverlets. They recommended a wonderful restaurant in the neighborhood that we loved, and called and made reservations for that one and another. We loved the terrace overlooking the canal for breakfast and early evening drinks. We had drinks in the bar a few nights and it was friendly and inviting. The neighborhood is perfect; just a short walk (15 minutes) to San Marco or a quick water taxi or vaporetto ride to anywhere you want to go, yet tucked away enough to feel you are experiencing the "real" Venice. The squares and restaurants in Dorsoduro were very nice! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants quiet luxury in a beautiful setting. Being a guest in this beautiful palazzo is the treat of a lifetime, and I hope to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: Rach09
Reviews.Content: What can we say but a very big thank you to all the staff especially Anna Dazzo(manageress)and Manuel (reception) for all their hard work in making our dream Wedding reception come true. After several trips to Venice including looking at other 5 star hotels we knew that this hotel (formerly a Palace) situated on the Grand Canal would make a perfect venue to hold our Wedding Reception. We hired the whole of the terrace for our reception to make it a private function and it was worth every penny. Having only recently been renovated we knew that the hotel and rooms would be of a high standard and would not be shabby like some of the other hotels we had looked at. We booked the room at the front of the hotel facing the Grand Canal with the balcony and we felt like royalty waving to all the tourists on the vaparetto's. The hotel is boutique in style and is situated in a quiet part of Dorsorduro without the large crowds of tourists. The reception meal was out of this world- 8 courses in total with cocktails, canapes and drinks, there was so much we couldn't finish it all. The tables where decorated beautifully with pink roses and tealight candles which looked beautiful just as the sun was setting on the Grand Canal. The hotel had left us a Wedding gift of scented rose shaped candles- which were very beutiful and will remind us of our special day- THANK YOU!. The breakfast was continental style and there was enough choice to suit everyone. We could not fault anything about the staff or hotel and would love to return again soon (maybe next year!) Thank you for all your help and hard work in making our Wedding a day to remember. Rachael & Jay xxx

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned: We were misled and will not be back.”
Reviews.Author: WhitsEnd4
Reviews.Content: Although I have read through all the glowing remarks from other travelers, as well as the reply comments by the hotel management, my review is written to reflect on the downside of not receiving what you pay for and the rude hotel staff that did nothing to correct their error. We booked our one night stay through Hotels.com. Perhaps that was our first mistake. We paid for 2 Adults and 2 Children to stay in a Junior Suite Grand Canal View with 2 Queen Beds. It was printed on our confirmation as just that. The cost was approximately US $800. Upon arrival we were informed by the receptionist that the suite we had reserved was not available, but that we would be provided with a room of comparable value and quality. But here is the kicker, the next morning upon checkout we were informed that they DID have our original suite and why didn't we ask for it? Huh?!! No kidding, that's what they said after we repeatedly went over with them that we had a confirmed reservation for a Junior Suite Grande Canal View and, if they did not have it, we should be credited for the difference in the cost of the rooms. They insisted that we would be provided with a similar room and no credit would be issued. The "suite" we were given instead was on the fifth floor, had one queen bed, and a non-pullout couch. I reminded the front desk agent that we had four people staying in our room. So what do we get?...a cot delivered to our room. This was our "suite". And although my 5 year old daughter slept on the cot, if we had wanted the "camping" experience, we would have stayed at one of our local campgrounds back in the States, not an $800 per night hotel in Venice. That said, where was our jacuzzi tub that I read so many other travelers commenting on? Our "suite" only had a shower, which was broken, AND there was a gapping hole in the wall...perhaps the "extensive" remodeling which took place three months prior to our stay was not quite finished in our "suite"? Now I would like to comment on our "grand canal view"? What was so grand about it?...it would have been grand if we had the neck of a giraffe and could hang out the window from our waist up to see around the corner. And that would have been ideal only if we had been able to open the window properly and someone hung onto our waist to prevent us from falling out! That said, thank goodness Venice is a magnificant city because it saved our feelings on our visit. After attempting to receive some sort of a credit (we were not looking for a refund), without any success, for the difference in our room category from the hotel staff and management, as well as hotels.com, triple check your reservation before you decide to stay in this hotel. If this is how they treat their guests who are rightfully upset for not getting what they pay for, then shame on them for carrying four stars. Feel free to try and defend your staff's behavior Mr. Management. I have read how any negative comments against your hotel are labeled as lies and misleading. Who was mislead here?

Reviews.Title: “We felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: galeriacorazon
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at Palazzo Stern...it so much exceeded our expectations. Our room was gorgeous...overlooking the Grand Canal with a large open window and two chairs with a table in front. Our bath had a giant Villery & Boch jacuzzi tub. We were celebrating our anniversary and the hotel had prosecco on ice for us when we arrived (after 25 hours of travel)...what a delight! All of the decor is first class. The people working there were very friendly and went out of their way to help us all the time The location is perfect; away from the mob scene in St. Mark's and Rialto, but just a 5 minute Vaporetto ride. There is a troghetto right in front, and the Ca Rezonnico vaporetto stop is next door. We walked to Academia, Santa Margarita and all around Dordogne in 5 minutes...Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal is perfect, and the food was wonderful. I have rarely enjoyed another hotel as much as this one...I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a real quality experience, and we hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bristolfarmboy
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Palazzo Stern in early July and I'd highly recommend it. It's right on the Vaporetto stop and a traghetto crossing so it's easy to get into the "tourist zone". Walk in the other direction and you're in Dorsudoro with great bars, restaurants etc and much quieter than San Marco. The hotel is really stylish and everybody there was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast on the Grand Canal balcony was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: jlramirez
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the most beautiful hotels we ever stayed at. I felt like a queen for 3 days. The location is great, the hotel is grand and unique. the breakfast wonderful as well as Junior, the waiter that served us in the morning, he was very helpful and a hard worker. As far as the front desk, I agree with one of the recent reviews. I felt that they werent very pleasant, but they were helpful when we requested it. Kind of felt that we were bothering them. Turns out that Andre Botelli was performing at St. Marks Square and I thought that was major news to tell your guests, but I guess they didnt think so. We found out that he performed at the square in the newspaperl. So I was disappointed that the staff did not bother to share this information to the guests. But the location, hotel and everything else would bring us back there. We enjoyed our stay at Palazzo Stern.

Reviews.Title: “A Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FieldsGal
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon splurge, and we were not disappointed. We had a standard room, and it was huge and beautiful. My only criticism would be inadequate reading light. We had breakfast each morning on the terrace, situated along the Grand Canal, and a fabulous breakfast it was. LOVED the beautiful restoration of this old palace, sumptuous but on a human scale (not intimidating). The staff was very helpful and was able to get us dinner reservations at very popular restaurants (by the way, Osteria da Fiore stands up to the hype and is phenomenal). Also loved the fabulous location, in lovely Dorsoduro (out of the madness of St. Mark's) but with a Vaporetto stop outside our door, and a troghetto to take us across the canal as well. Nothing in Venice is cheap, so I say, if you're going there and want to splurge, the Hotel Palazzo Stern is a great value. You spend a lot, but you can easily imagine yourself back in the heyday of Venetian wealth and highly developed aesthetics. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: onewharf
Reviews.Content: Susan and I decided a few months ago to go to Venice for our honeymoon, and just got back a couple of days ago. We'd hoped that Venice would be warm-ish by April (which it was for 4 days out of 5) but without the huge hordes of tourists that come in the summer. We'd had a recommendation for the Palazzo Stern from a friend who stayed last year and also checked it out on Trip Advisor. The short story is that the Palazzo Stern met all our expectations, and then some! We caught a private water taxi from the airport which pulls up right outside the hotel. The staff took our bags, we had a short check-in and a brief tour of the hotel and then up to our room. We were in 405 on the second floor which has a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal - probably more expensive than most rooms there but we were on honeymoon. The architecture, design, room size, cleanliness and service were just great. Breakfast is served until 10.30am and is on a fantastic terrace in front of the hotel and right on the Grand Canal. Service to the room was excellent and we had many quite reasonably priced cappucino's and glasses of red wine delivered to the room. The staff don't make you sign for it and don't hang around for tips so it made the room service a great experience. There were no bath robes in the room but we asked for some and they were there in minutes. We also had a spa (with champagne of course) in their tub on the top floor. All in all the room and the service was top notch and I can't think of a thing to fault. The location was also great - right next to a vaporetto water taxi stop and in a lovely neighbourhood with lots of charming restaurants and shops and only 5-10 mins walk from some of the best art galleries and churches. Far better than around St Marks Square. Highly recommended for a honeymoon or romantic stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palazzo Stern
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 2792-2794/A-2792/B, 30123 Venice, Italy
